We recommend using Intention when the entity has the ability to control the implementation and Expectation for when the entity does not have control or for what happens after or beyond the exercise of control.;Expectation is associated with the outcome of a goal or purpose for what is expected to happen i.e. an ex-post indication of what was expected to happen in the specified context. Intention and Expectation are closely related terms. We recommend using Intention when the entity has the ability to control the implementation and Expectation for when the entity does not have control or for what happens after or beyond the exercise of control.

label: Expected
definition: Status indicating the specified context was expected

label: Explicitly Expressed Consent
definition: Consent that is expressed through an explicit action solely conveying a consenting decision
scopenote: Explicitly expressed consent is a more specific form of Expressed consent where the action taken must 'explicitly' relate to only the consent decision. Expressed consent where the consenting is part of other matters therefore cannot satisfy the requirements of explicitly expressed consent. An example of explicit action expressing the consenting decision is a button on a web form where the form only relates to consent, or it is accompanied with suitable text that reiterates what the consenting decision is about;Explicitly expressed consent is a more specific form of Expressed consent where the action taken must 'explicitly' relate to only the consent decision. Expressed consent where the consenting is part of other matters therefore cannot satisfy the requirements of explicitly expressed consent. An example of explicit action expressing the consenting decision is a button on a web form where the form only relates to consent, or it is accompanied with suitable text that reiterates what the consenting decision is about;Explicitly expressed consent is a more specific form of Expressed consent where the action taken must 'explicitly' relate to only the consent decision. Expressed consent where the consenting is part of other matters therefore cannot satisfy the requirements of explicitly expressed consent. An example of explicit action expressing the consenting decision is a button on a web form where the form only relates to consent, or it is accompanied with suitable text that reiterates what the consenting decision is about

label: Export
definition: to provide a copy of data from one system to another

label: Expressed Consent
definition: Consent that is expressed through an action intended to convey a consenting decision
scopenote: Expressed consent requires the individual take a specific and unambigious action that directly indicates their consent. This action may be a part of other processes such as setting preferences, or agreeing to a contract, or other matters not relating to consent. An example of expressed consent is interacting with a checkbox within a dashboard or clicking a button on a web form;Expressed consent requires the individual take a specific and unambigious action that directly indicates their consent. This action may be a part of other processes such as setting preferences, or agreeing to a contract, or other matters not relating to consent. An example of expressed consent is interacting with a checkbox within a dashboard or clicking a button on a web form;Expressed consent requires the individual take a specific and unambigious action that directly indicates their consent. This action may be a part of other processes such as setting preferences, or agreeing to a contract, or other matters not relating to consent. An example of expressed consent is interacting with a checkbox within a dashboard or clicking a button on a web form

label: Fundamental Rights Impact Assessment (FRIA)
definition: Impact assessment which assesses the potential and actual impact on fundamental rights occuring due to processing activities
scopenote: The fundamental rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction - for example see EU Charter of Fundamental Rights;The fundamental rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction - for example see EU Charter of Fundamental Rights;The fundamental rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction - for example see EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

label: Federated Locations
definition: Location that is federated across multiple separate areas with designation of a primary or central location

label: File System Security
definition: Security implemented over a file system

label: Filter
definition: to filter or keep data for some criteria

label: Fixed Location
definition: Location that is fixed i.e. known to occur at a specific place

label: Fixed Multiple Locations
definition: Location that is fixed with multiple places e.g. multiple cities

label: Fixed Occurences Duration
definition: Duration that takes place a fixed number of times e.g. 3 times

label: Fixed Singular Location
definition: Location that is fixed at a specific place e.g. a city

label: For-Profit Organisation
definition: An organisation that aims to achieve profit as its primary goal

label: Format
definition: to arrange or structure data in a specific form

label: Fraud Prevention and Detection
definition: Purposes associated with fraud detection, prevention, and mitigation

label: Frequency
definition: The frequency or information about periods and repetitions in terms of recurrence.

label: Fulfilment of Contractual Obligation
definition: Purposes associated with carrying out data processing to fulfill a contractual obligation

label: Fulfilment of Obligation
definition: Purposes associated with carrying out data processing to fulfill an obligation

label: Full Automation
definition: Level of automation corresponding to Level 5 in ISO/IEC 22989:2022 where the automation in system is capable of performing all its tasks regardless of the conditions without human involvement
scopenote: Though Fully Automated such operations can still be associated with dpv:HumanInvolved e.g. for inputs, oversight or verification;Though Fully Automated such operations can still be associated with dpv:HumanInvolved e.g. for inputs, oversight or verification;Though Fully Automated such operations can still be associated with dpv:HumanInvolved e.g. for inputs, oversight or verification

label: Fully Randomised Pseudonymisation
definition: Use of randomised pseudonymisation where the same elements are assigned different values each time they occur

label: Generate
definition: to generate or create data

label: Generated Data
definition: Data that has been obtained through generation or creation as a source

label: Generated Personal Data
definition: Personal Data that is generated or brought into existence without relation to existing data i.e. it is not derived or inferred from other data
scopenote: Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data;Generated Data is used to indicate data that is produced and is not derived or inferred from other data

label: Geographic Coverage
definition: Indicate of scale in terms of geographic coverage

label: Global Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning the entire globe

label: Governance Procedures
definition: Procedures related to governance (e.g. organisation, unit, team, process, system)

label: Governmental Organisation
definition: An organisation managed or part of government

label: Guardian(s) of Data Subject
definition: Guardian(s) of data subjects such as children

label: Guideline
definition: Practices that specify how activities must be conducted

label: GuidelinesPrinciple
definition: Guidelines or Principles regarding processing and operational measures

label: Hardware Security Protocols
definition: Security protocols implemented at or within hardware

label: Hash Functions
definition: Use of hash functions to map information or to retrieve a prior categorisation

label: Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC)
definition: Use of HMAC where message authentication code (MAC) utilise a cryptographic hash function and a secret cryptographic key

label: High Automation
definition: Level of automation corresponding to Level 4 in ISO/IEC 22989:2022 where the automation in system is capable of performing all its tasks within specific controlled conditions without human involvement
scopenote: Human Involvement is implied here, e.g. for intervention, input, decisions;Human Involvement is implied here, e.g. for intervention, input, decisions;Human Involvement is implied here, e.g. for intervention, input, decisions

label: Homomorphic Encryption
definition: Use of Homomorphic encryption that permits computations on encrypted data without decrypting it

label: Huge Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered huge or more than large within the context

label: Huge Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered huge or more than large within the context

label: Human involved
definition: Humans are involved in the specified context
scopenote: This concept only indicates that humans are involved. For specific involvement, see specialised concepts e.g. involved for input, oversight.;This concept only indicates that humans are involved. For specific involvement, see specialised concepts e.g. involved for input, oversight.;This concept only indicates that humans are involved. For specific involvement, see specialised concepts e.g. involved for input, oversight.

label: Human Involvement
definition: The involvement of humans in specified context
scopenote: Human Involvement here broadly refers to any involvement by a human in the context of carrying out processing. This may include verification of outcomes, providing input data for making decisions, or overseeing activities. To indicate whether humans are involved or not, see relevant concepts of dpv:HumanInvolved and dpv:HumanNotInvolved. The term 'Human in the loop' and its varieties are absent from DPV due to their contradictory and non-compatible use across different sources.;Human Involvement here broadly refers to any involvement by a human in the context of carrying out processing. This may include verification of outcomes, providing input data for making decisions, or overseeing activities. To indicate whether humans are involved or not, see relevant concepts of dpv:HumanInvolved and dpv:HumanNotInvolved. The term 'Human in the loop' and its varieties are absent from DPV due to their contradictory and non-compatible use across different sources.

label: Human Involvement for control
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of exercising control over the specified operations in context
scopenote: Control is a broad term that can be applied to various stages and operations. It maps to None, Assistive, and Partial automation models.;Control is a broad term that can be applied to various stages and operations. It maps to None, Assistive, and Partial automation models.;Control is a broad term that can be applied to various stages and operations. It maps to None, Assistive, and Partial automation models.

label: Human Involvement for decision
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of exercising decisions over the specified operations in context
scopenote: Decisions are about exercising control over the operation, and are distinct from input (data or parameters).;Decisions are about exercising control over the operation, and are distinct from input (data or parameters).;Decisions are about exercising control over the operation, and are distinct from input (data or parameters).

label: Human Involvement for Input
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of providing inputs to the specified context
scopenote: Inputs can be in the form of data or other resources.;Inputs can be in the form of data or other resources.;Inputs can be in the form of data or other resources.

label: Human Involvement for intervention
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of exercising interventions over the specified operations in context
scopenote: Intervention indicates the ability to intervene in operations, which can be at various stages. It maps to Conditional and High automation models.;Intervention indicates the ability to intervene in operations, which can be at various stages. It maps to Conditional and High automation models.;Intervention indicates the ability to intervene in operations, which can be at various stages. It maps to Conditional and High automation models.

label: Human Involvement for Oversight
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of having oversight over the specified context regarding its operations, inputs, or outputs
scopenote: Oversight by itself does not indicate the ability to intervene or control the operations.;Oversight by itself does not indicate the ability to intervene or control the operations.;Oversight by itself does not indicate the ability to intervene or control the operations.

label: Human Involvement for Verification
definition: Human involvement for the purposes of verification of specified context to ensure its operations, inputs, or outputs are correct or are acceptable.
scopenote: Verification by itself does not imply ability to Control, Intervene, or having Oversight.;Verification by itself does not imply ability to Control, Intervene, or having Oversight.;Verification by itself does not imply ability to Control, Intervene, or having Oversight.

label: Human not involved
definition: Humans are not involved in the specified context
scopenote: This maps to Autonomous and Full Automation models if no humans are involved.;This maps to Autonomous and Full Automation models if no humans are involved.;This maps to Autonomous and Full Automation models if no humans are involved.

label: Human Resource Management
definition: Purposes associated with managing humans and 'human resources' within the organisation for effective and efficient operations.
scopenote: HR is a broad concept. Its management includes, amongst others - recruiting employees and intermediaries e.g. brokers, independent representatives; payroll administration, remunerations, commissions, and wages; and application of social legislation.;HR is a broad concept. Its management includes, amongst others - recruiting employees and intermediaries e.g. brokers, independent representatives; payroll administration, remunerations, commissions, and wages; and application of social legislation.;HR is a broad concept. Its management includes, amongst others - recruiting employees and intermediaries e.g. brokers, independent representatives; payroll administration, remunerations, commissions, and wages; and application of social legislation.

label: Intellectual Property Rights Management
definition: Management of Intellectual Property Rights with a view to identify and safeguard and enforce them

label: Identity Authentication
definition: Purposes associated with performing authentication based on identity as a form of security

label: Identity Management Method
definition: Management of identity and identity-based processes

label: Identity Verification
definition: Purposes associated with verifying or authenticating identity as a form of security

label: Immigrant
definition: Data subjects that are immigrants (for a jurisdiction)

label: Impact
definition: The impact(s) possible or arising as a consequence from specified context
scopenote: Impact is a stronger notion of consequence in terms of influence, change, or effect on something e.g. for impact assessments;Impact is a stronger notion of consequence in terms of influence, change, or effect on something e.g. for impact assessments

label: Impact Assessment
definition: Calculating or determining the likelihood of impact of an existing or proposed process, which can involve risks or detriments.

label: Implied Consent
definition: Consent that is implied indirectly through an action not associated solely with conveying a consenting decision
scopenote: Implied consent is expected to also be Informed Consent. An example is a CCTV notice outside a monitored area that informs the individuals that by walking in they would be consenting to the use of camera for surveillance.;Implied consent is expected to also be Informed Consent. An example is a CCTV notice outside a monitored area that informs the individuals that by walking in they would be consenting to the use of camera for surveillance.;Implied consent is expected to also be Informed Consent. An example is a CCTV notice outside a monitored area that informs the individuals that by walking in they would be consenting to the use of camera for surveillance.

label: Importance
definition: An indication of 'importance' within a context
scopenote: Importance can be used to express importance, desirability, relevance, or significance as a context.;Importance can be used to express importance, desirability, relevance, or significance as a context.

label: Improve Existing Products and Services
definition: Purposes associated with improving existing products and services

label: Improve Internal CRM Processes
definition: Purposes associated with improving customer-relationship management (CRM) processes

label: Incident Management Procedures
definition: Procedures related to management of incidents

label: Incident Reporting Communication
definition: Procedures related to management of incident reporting

label: Incorrect Data
definition: Data that is known to be incorrect or inconsistent with some requirements

label: Increase Service Robustness
definition: Purposes associated with improving robustness and resilience of services

label: Indeterminate Duration
definition: Duration that is indeterminate or cannot be determined
scopenote: Indeterminate means (exact or otherwise) information about the duration cannot be determined, which is distinct from 'EndlessDuration' where it is known (or decided) that the duration is open-ended or without an end.;Indeterminate means (exact or otherwise) information about the duration cannot be determined, which is distinct from 'EndlessDuration' where it is known (or decided) that the duration is open-ended or without an end.;Indeterminate means (exact or otherwise) information about the duration cannot be determined, which is distinct from 'EndlessDuration' where it is known (or decided) that the duration is open-ended or without an end.

label: Industry Consortium
definition: A consortium established and comprising on industry organisations

label: Infer
definition: to infer data from existing data
scopenote: Infer indicates data that is derived without it being present or obtainable from existing data. For data that is presented, and is 'extracted' or 'obtained' from existing data, see Derive.;Infer indicates data that is derived without it being present or obtainable from existing data. For data that is presented, and is 'extracted' or 'obtained' from existing data, see Derive.;Infer indicates data that is derived without it being present or obtainable from existing data. For data that is presented, and is 'extracted' or 'obtained' from existing data, see Derive.

label: Inferred Data
definition: Data that has been obtained through inferences of other data

label: Inferred Personal Data
definition: Personal Data that is obtained through inference from other data
