label: Information Flow Control
definition: Use of measures to control information flows

label: Information Security Policy
definition: Policy regarding security of information

label: Informed Consent
definition: Consent that is informed i.e. with the requirement to provide sufficient information to make a consenting decision
scopenote: The specifics for what information should be provided or made available will depend on the context, use-case, or relevant legal requirements;The specifics for what information should be provided or made available will depend on the context, use-case, or relevant legal requirements;The specifics for what information should be provided or made available will depend on the context, use-case, or relevant legal requirements

label: Innovative Use of Existing Technologies
definition: Involvement of existing technologies used in an innovative manner

label: Innovative Use of New Technologies
definition: Involvement of a new (innovative) technologies
scopenote: New technologies are by definition considered innovative;New technologies are by definition considered innovative;New technologies are by definition considered innovative

label: Innovative use of Technology
definition: Indicates that technology is being used in an innovative manner
scopenote: Innovative here refers to 'state of the art' rather than the implementing entity, and can be for either new technology or new uses of existing technology;Innovative here refers to 'state of the art' rather than the implementing entity, and can be for either new technology or new uses of existing technology

label: Intended
definition: Status indicating the specified context was intended

label: Intention Status
definition: Status indicating whether the specified context was intended or unintended
scopenote: Intention is associated with the goal or purpose for what is about to happen i.e. an ex-ante indication of whether the specified context is/was planned or intended. Intention and Expectation are closely related terms. We recommend using Intention when the entity has the ability to control the implementation and Expectation for when the entity does not have control or for what happens after or beyond the exercise of control.;Intention is associated with the goal or purpose for what is about to happen i.e. an ex-ante indication of whether the specified context is/was planned or intended. Intention and Expectation are closely related terms. We recommend using Intention when the entity has the ability to control the implementation and Expectation for when the entity does not have control or for what happens after or beyond the exercise of control.

label: Internal Resource Optimisation
definition: Purposes associated with optimisation of internal resource availability and usage for organisation

label: International Organisation
definition: An organisation and its subordinate bodies governed by public international law, or any other body which is set up by, or on the basis of, an agreement between two or more countries

label: Intrusion Detection System
definition: Use of measures to detect intrusions and other unauthorised attempts to gain access to a system

label: Involvement Status
definition: Status indicating whether the involvement of specified context

label: Job Applicant
definition: Data subjects that apply for jobs or employments

label: Joint Data Controllers
definition: A group of Data Controllers that jointly determine the purposes and means of processing
scopenote: While Joint Data Controllers operate together, they are made up of individually distinct legal entities. To indicate the membership of this group, hasDataController should be used to denote each Data Controller. The concept of Joint Data Controllers also allows specifying a single group as the 'Controller' and to specify role and responsibilities within that group for each entity using DPV's concepts (e.g. isImplementedByEntity);While Joint Data Controllers operate together, they are made up of individually distinct legal entities. To indicate the membership of this group, hasDataController should be used to denote each Data Controller. The concept of Joint Data Controllers also allows specifying a single group as the 'Controller' and to specify role and responsibilities within that group for each entity using DPV's concepts (e.g. isImplementedByEntity)

label: Joint Data Controllers Agreement
definition: An agreement outlining conditions, criteria, obligations, responsibilities, and specifics for carrying out processing of data between Controllers within a Joint Controllers relationship

label: Justification
definition: A form of documentation providing reaosns, explanations, or justifications

label: Large Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered large within the context

label: Large Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered large within the context

label: Large Scale Processing
definition: Processing that takes place at large scales (as specified by some criteria)
scopenote: The exact definition of what constitutes "large scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending this term with the appropriate context.;The exact definition of what constitutes "large scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending this term with the appropriate context.;The exact definition of what constitutes "large scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending this term with the appropriate context.

label: Law
definition: A law is a set of rules created by government or authorities

label: Lawful
definition: State of being lawful or legally compliant

label: Lawfulness
definition: Status associated with expressing lawfullness or legal compliance

label: Lawfulness Unknown
definition: State of the lawfulness not being known

label: Legal Agreement
definition: A legally binding agreement

label: Legal Basis
definition: Legal basis used to justify processing of data or use of technology in accordance with a law
scopenote: Legal basis (plural: legal bases) are defined by legislations and regulations, whose applicability is usually restricted to specific jurisdictions which can be represented using dpv:hasJurisdiction or dpv:hasLaw. Legal basis can be used without such declarations, e.g. 'Consent', however their interpretation will require association with a law, e.g. 'EU GDPR'.;Legal basis (plural: legal bases) are defined by legislations and regulations, whose applicability is usually restricted to specific jurisdictions which can be represented using dpv:hasJurisdiction or dpv:hasLaw. Legal basis can be used without such declarations, e.g. 'Consent', however their interpretation will require association with a law, e.g. 'EU GDPR'.

label: Legal Compliance
definition: Purposes associated with carrying out data processing to fulfill a legal or statutory obligation
scopenote: This purpose only refers to processing that is additionally required in order to fulfill the obligations and requirements associated with a law. For example, the use of consent would have its own separate purposes, with this purpose addressing a legal requirement for maintaining consent record (along with RecordManagement). This purpose will typically be used with Legal Obligation as the legal basis.;This purpose only refers to processing that is additionally required in order to fulfill the obligations and requirements associated with a law. For example, the use of consent would have its own separate purposes, with this purpose addressing a legal requirement for maintaining consent record (along with RecordManagement). This purpose will typically be used with Legal Obligation as the legal basis.;This purpose only refers to processing that is additionally required in order to fulfill the obligations and requirements associated with a law. For example, the use of consent would have its own separate purposes, with this purpose addressing a legal requirement for maintaining consent record (along with RecordManagement). This purpose will typically be used with Legal Obligation as the legal basis.

label: Legal Compliance Assessment
definition: Assessment regarding legal compliance

label: Legal Entity
definition: A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity and which is recognised and defined in law

label: Legal Measure
definition: Legal measures used to safeguard and ensure good practices in connection with data and technologies

label: Legal Obligation
definition: Legal Obligation to conduct the specified activities

label: Legitimate Interest
definition: Legitimate Interests of a Party as justification for specified activities

label: Legitimate Interest Assessment
definition: Indicates an assessment regarding the use of legitimate interest as a lawful basis by the data controller

label: Legitimate Interest of Controller
definition: Legitimate Interests of a Data Controller in conducting specified activities

label: Legitimate Interest of Data Subject
definition: Legitimate Interests of the Data Subject in conducting specified activities

label: Legitimate Interest of Third Party
definition: Legitimate Interests of a Third Party in conducting specified activities

label: Likelihood
definition: The likelihood or probability or chance of something taking place or occuring
scopenote: Likelihood can be expressed in a subjective manner, such as 'Unlikely', or in a quantitative manner such as "Twice in a Day" (frequency per period). The suggestion is to use quantitative values, or to associate them with subjective terms used so as to enable accurate interpretations and interoperability. See the concepts related to Frequency and Duration for possible uses as a combination to express Likelihood.;Likelihood can be expressed in a subjective manner, such as 'Unlikely', or in a quantitative manner such as "Twice in a Day" (frequency per period). The suggestion is to use quantitative values, or to associate them with subjective terms used so as to enable accurate interpretations and interoperability. See the concepts related to Frequency and Duration for possible uses as a combination to express Likelihood.

label: Local Environment Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning a specific environment within the locality
scopenote: For example, geographic scale of an event take place in a specific building or room;For example, geographic scale of an event take place in a specific building or room;For example, geographic scale of an event take place in a specific building or room

label: Local Location
definition: Location is local

label: Locality Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning a specific locality
scopenote: For example, geographic scale of a city or an area within a city;For example, geographic scale of a city or an area within a city;For example, geographic scale of a city or an area within a city

label: Location
definition: A location is a position, site, or area where something is located
scopenote: Location may be geographic, physical, or virtual.;Location may be geographic, physical, or virtual.

label: Location Fixture
definition: The fixture of location refers to whether the location is fixed

label: Location Locality
definition: Locality refers to whether the specified location is local within some context, e.g. for the user

label: Logging Policy
definition: Policy for logging of information

label: Maintain Credit Checking Database
definition: Purposes associated with maintaining a Credit Checking Database

label: Maintain Credit Rating Database
definition: Purposes associated with maintaining a Credit Rating Database

label: Maintain Fraud Database
definition: Purposes associated with maintaining a database related to identifying and identified fraud risks and fraud incidents

label: Make Available
definition: to transform or publish data to be used

label: Marketing
definition: Purposes associated with conducting marketing in relation to organisation or products or services e.g. promoting, selling, and distributing
scopenote: Was commercial interest, changed to consider Marketing a separate Purpose category by itself;Was commercial interest, changed to consider Marketing a separate Purpose category by itself;Was commercial interest, changed to consider Marketing a separate Purpose category by itself

label: Match
definition: to combine, compare, or match data from different sources

label: Medium Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered medium i.e. neither large nor small within the context

label: Medium Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered medium i.e. neither large nor small within the context

label: Medium Scale Processing
definition: Processing that takes place at medium scales (as specified by some criteria)

label: Member
definition: Data subjects that are members of a group, organisation, or other collectives

label: Members and Partners Management
definition: Purposes associated with maintaining a registry of shareholders, members, or partners for governance, administration, and management functions

label: Mentally Vulnerable Data Subject
definition: Data subjects that are considered mentally vulnerable

label: Message Authentication Codes (MAC)
definition: Use of cryptographic methods to authenticate messages

label: Metadata Management
definition: Measures associated with management of metadata
scopenote: Examples of metadata management include assessing which metadata are required or being used by technology, assessing their potential inclusion as personal data, and implementing a metadata based solution to manage data;Examples of metadata management include assessing which metadata are required or being used by technology, assessing their potential inclusion as personal data, and implementing a metadata based solution to manage data;Examples of metadata management include assessing which metadata are required or being used by technology, assessing their potential inclusion as personal data, and implementing a metadata based solution to manage data

label: Mobile Platform Security
definition: Security implemented over a mobile platform

label: Modify
definition: to modify or change data

label: Monitor
definition: to monitor data for some criteria

label: Monitoring Policy
definition: Policy for monitoring (e.g. progress, performance)

label: Monotonic Counter Pseudonymisation
definition: A simple pseudonymisation method where identifiers are substituted by a number chosen by a monotonic counter

label: Move
definition: to move data from one location to another including deleting the original copy

label: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
definition: An authentication system that uses two or more methods to authenticate

label: Multi National Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning multiple nations

label: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
definition: Non-disclosure Agreements e.g. preserving confidentiality of information

label: National Authority
definition: An authority tasked with overseeing legal compliance for a nation

label: National Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning a nation

label: Natural Person
definition: A human

label: Nearly Global Scale
definition: Geographic coverage nearly spanning the entire globe

label: Necessity
definition: An indication of 'necessity' within a context
scopenote: Necessity can be used to express need, essentiality, requirement, or compulsion.;Necessity can be used to express need, essentiality, requirement, or compulsion.

label: Network Proxy Routing
definition: Use of network routing using proxy

label: Network Security Protocols
definition: Security implemented at or over networks protocols

label: Non-Citizen
definition: Data subjects that are not citizens (for a jurisdiction)

label: Non-Commercial Research
definition: Purposes associated with conducting research in a non-commercial setting e.g. for a non-profit-organisation (NGO)

label: Non Compliant
definition: State of non-compliance where objectives have not been met, but have not been violated
scopenote: Changed from not compliant for consistency in commonly used terms;Changed from not compliant for consistency in commonly used terms;Changed from not compliant for consistency in commonly used terms

label: NonConformant
definition: State of being non-conformant

label: Non-Governmental Organisation
definition: An organisation not part of or independent from the government

label: Non-Personal Data
definition: Data that is not Personal Data
scopenote: The term NonPersonalData is provided to distinguish between PersonalData and other data, e.g. for indicating which data is regulated by privacy laws. To specify personal data that has been anonymised, the concept AnonymisedData should be used as the anonymisation process has a risk of not being fully effective and such anonymous data may be found to be personal data depending on circumstances.;The term NonPersonalData is provided to distinguish between PersonalData and other data, e.g. for indicating which data is regulated by privacy laws. To specify personal data that has been anonymised, the concept AnonymisedData should be used as the anonymisation process has a risk of not being fully effective and such anonymous data may be found to be personal data depending on circumstances.

label: Non-Profit Organisation
definition: An organisation that does not aim to achieve profit as its primary goal

label: Non-Public Data Source
definition: A source of data that is not publicly accessible or available

label: Not Applicable
definition: Concept indicating the information or context is not applicable
scopenote: This concept is useful when describing situations where information must be provided to indicate the context does not apply and leaving a blank field or having no value or triple is not an option. For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed and the response to that would be "not applicable (N/A)" - then this is represented using the concept NotApplicable. If instead the value was left blank the open-world interpretation creates an ambiguity as to whether the information was not available or was it not provided as it is not applicable.;This concept is useful when describing situations where information must be provided to indicate the context does not apply and leaving a blank field or having no value or triple is not an option. For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed and the response to that would be "not applicable (N/A)" - then this is represented using the concept NotApplicable. If instead the value was left blank the open-world interpretation creates an ambiguity as to whether the information was not available or was it not provided as it is not applicable.;This concept is useful when describing situations where information must be provided to indicate the context does not apply and leaving a blank field or having no value or triple is not an option. For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed and the response to that would be "not applicable (N/A)" - then this is represented using the concept NotApplicable. If instead the value was left blank the open-world interpretation creates an ambiguity as to whether the information was not available or was it not provided as it is not applicable.

label: Not Automated
definition: Level of automation corresponding to Level 0 in ISO/IEC 22989:2022 where there is no automation in the system
scopenote: Human Involvement is necessary here as there is no automation;Human Involvement is necessary here as there is no automation;Human Involvement is necessary here as there is no automation

label: Not Available
definition: Concept indicating the information or context is applicable but information is not yet available
scopenote: This concept is useful when describing situations where information is required but is not available (yet). For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed, and it is correct to interpret that process X is applicable and must be completed, but the information is not yet available as to whether this was done - then NotAvailable is useful to represent this.;This concept is useful when describing situations where information is required but is not available (yet). For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed, and it is correct to interpret that process X is applicable and must be completed, but the information is not yet available as to whether this was done - then NotAvailable is useful to represent this.;This concept is useful when describing situations where information is required but is not available (yet). For example, if in a form a field asks about whether a process X was completed, and it is correct to interpret that process X is applicable and must be completed, but the information is not yet available as to whether this was done - then NotAvailable is useful to represent this.

label: Not Involved
definition: Status indicating the specified context is 'not' involved

label: Not Required
definition: Indication of neither being required nor optional i.e. not relevant or needed

label: Notice
definition: A notice is an artefact for providing information, choices, or controls
scopenote: Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. In several cases, they are used interchangeably - for example Privacy Notice as a measure or control refers to both the information as well as the act of making it available. For 'active' contexts where this distinction is important, e.g. data breach notifications, see Notification concept.;Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. In several cases, they are used interchangeably - for example Privacy Notice as a measure or control refers to both the information as well as the act of making it available. For 'active' contexts where this distinction is important, e.g. data breach notifications, see Notification concept.;Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. In several cases, they are used interchangeably - for example Privacy Notice as a measure or control refers to both the information as well as the act of making it available. For 'active' contexts where this distinction is important, e.g. data breach notifications, see Notification concept.

label: Notification
definition: Notification represents the provision of a notice i.e. notifying
scopenote: Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. The distinction is important as there are specific obligations associated with notice and notifications. For example, a data breach notice refers to the information about the breach intended to be provided to another entity, whereas notification refers to the act of providing the entity with the notice;Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. The distinction is important as there are specific obligations associated with notice and notifications. For example, a data breach notice refers to the information about the breach intended to be provided to another entity, whereas notification refers to the act of providing the entity with the notice;Notice refers to the information whereas Notification refers to the provision of that notice. The distinction is important as there are specific obligations associated with notice and notifications. For example, a data breach notice refers to the information about the breach intended to be provided to another entity, whereas notification refers to the act of providing the entity with the notice

label: Notification Completed
definition: Status indicating notification(s) are completed

label: Notification Failed
definition: Status indicating notification(s) could not be completed due to a failure

label: Notification Not Needed
definition: Status indicating notification(s) are not needed

label: Notification Ongoing
definition: Status indicating notification(s) are ongoing

label: Notification Planned
definition: Status indicating notification(s) are planned

label: Notification Status
definition: Status indicating whether notification(s) are planned, completed, or failed

label: Objecting to Process
definition: Involvement where entity can object to process of specified context

label: Obligation
definition: A rule describing an obligation for performing an activity

label: Observe
definition: to obtain data through observation

label: Observed Data
definition: Data that has been obtained through observations of a source

label: Observed Personal Data
definition: Personal Data that has been collected through observation of the Data Subject(s)

label: Obtain
definition: to solicit or gather data from someone

label: Obtain Consent
definition: Control for obtaining consent
scopenote: Indicates how the controller or entity can obtain consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the controller or entity can obtain consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt

label: Official Authority of Controller
definition: Activities are necessary or authorised through the official authority granted to or vested in the Data Controller

label: Often Frequency
definition: Frequency where occurences are often or frequent, but not continous

label: Operating System Security
definition: Security implemented at or through operating systems

label: Optimisation for Consumer
definition: Purposes associated with optimisation of activities and services for consumer or user
scopenote: The term optmisation here refers to the efficiency of the service in terms of technical provision (or similar means) with benefits for everybody. Personalisation implies making changes that benefit the current user or persona.;The term optmisation here refers to the efficiency of the service in terms of technical provision (or similar means) with benefits for everybody. Personalisation implies making changes that benefit the current user or persona.;The term optmisation here refers to the efficiency of the service in terms of technical provision (or similar means) with benefits for everybody. Personalisation implies making changes that benefit the current user or persona.

label: Optimisation for Controller
definition: Purposes associated with optimisation of activities and services for provider or controller

label: Optimise User Interface
definition: Purposes associated with optimisation of interfaces presented to the user

label: Opting in to Process
definition: Involvement where entity can opt-in to specified context

label: Opting out of Process
definition: Involvement where entity can opt-out from specified context

label: Optional
definition: Indication of 'optional' or 'voluntary'

label: Organisation
definition: A general term reflecting a company or a business or a group acting as a unit

label: Organisation Compliance Management
definition: Purposes associated with managing compliance for organisation in relation to internal policies
scopenote: Note that this concept relates to internal organisational compliance. The concept LegalCompliance should be used for external legal or regulatory compliance.;Note that this concept relates to internal organisational compliance. The concept LegalCompliance should be used for external legal or regulatory compliance.;Note that this concept relates to internal organisational compliance. The concept LegalCompliance should be used for external legal or regulatory compliance.

label: Organisation Governance
definition: Purposes associated with conducting activities and functions for governance of an organisation

label: Organisation Risk Management
definition: Purposes associated with managing risk for organisation's activities

label: Organisational Measure
definition: Organisational measures used to safeguard and ensure good practices in connection with data and technologies

label: Organisational Unit
definition: Entity within an organisation that does not constitute as a separate legal entity

label: Organise
definition: to organize data for arranging or classifying

label: Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA)
definition: Impact assessment regarding privacy risks

label: Parent Legal Entity
definition: A legal entity that has one or more subsidiary entities operating under it

label: Parent(s) of Data Subject
definition: Parent(s) of data subjects such as children

label: Partial Automation
definition: Level of automation corresponding to Level 2 in ISO/IEC 22989:2022 where the automation is present in multiple parts of the system or in a manner that does not require the human to contro/use these parts while still retaining control over the system
scopenote: Human Involvement is implied here, specifically the ability to Control operations, but also possibly for intervention, oversight, and verification;Human Involvement is implied here, specifically the ability to Control operations, but also possibly for intervention, oversight, and verification;Human Involvement is implied here, specifically the ability to Control operations, but also possibly for intervention, oversight, and verification

label: Partially Compliant
definition: State of partially being compliant i.e. only some objectives have been met, and others have not been in violation

label: Participant
definition: Data subjects that participate in some context such as volunteers in a function

label: Passive Right
definition: The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected that are always (passively) applicable
scopenote: Passive rights do not require the entity to request or exercise them. They are considered to be always applicable. For example, the Right to Privacy (in EU) does not require an exercise for it to be fulfilled.;Passive rights do not require the entity to request or exercise them. They are considered to be always applicable. For example, the Right to Privacy (in EU) does not require an exercise for it to be fulfilled.;Passive rights do not require the entity to request or exercise them. They are considered to be always applicable. For example, the Right to Privacy (in EU) does not require an exercise for it to be fulfilled.

label: Passively Involved
definition: Status indicating the specified context is 'passively' involved
scopenote: An example of passive involvement is a person being monitored by a CCTV;An example of passive involvement is a person being monitored by a CCTV;An example of passive involvement is a person being monitored by a CCTV

label: Password Authentication
definition: Use of passwords to perform authentication

label: Patient
definition: Data subjects that receive medican attention, treatment, care, advice, or other health related services

label: Payment Management
definition: Purposes associated with processing and managing payment in relation to service, including invoicing and records

label: Penetration Testing Methods
definition: Use of penetration testing to identify weaknesses and vulnerabilities through simulations

label: Permission
definition: A rule describing a permission to perform an activity

label: Permission Management
definition: Methods to obtain, provide, modify, and withdraw permissions alongwith maintaining a record of permissions, retrieving records, and processing changes in permission states
scopenote: Permission is a broader concept than '(Informed) Consent' as consent when used as a legal basis has specific requirements to be valid. For management of consent, see the concept dpv:ConsentManagement;Permission is a broader concept than '(Informed) Consent' as consent when used as a legal basis has specific requirements to be valid. For management of consent, see the concept dpv:ConsentManagement;Permission is a broader concept than '(Informed) Consent' as consent when used as a legal basis has specific requirements to be valid. For management of consent, see the concept dpv:ConsentManagement

label: Personal Data
definition: Data directly or indirectly associated or related to an individual.
scopenote: This definition of personal data encompasses the concepts used in GDPR Art.4-1 for 'personal data' and ISO/IEC 2700 for 'personally identifiable information (PII)'.;This definition of personal data encompasses the concepts used in GDPR Art.4-1 for 'personal data' and ISO/IEC 2700 for 'personally identifiable information (PII)'.

label: Personal Data Handling
definition: An abstract concept describing 'personal data handling'
scopenote: This concept will be deprecated in future updates. It is recommended to use dpv:PersonalDataProcess as the equivalent alternative which is better aligned with legal and operational terminology.;This concept will be deprecated in future updates. It is recommended to use dpv:PersonalDataProcess as the equivalent alternative which is better aligned with legal and operational terminology.

label: Personalisation
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing customisation based on attributes and/or needs of person(s) or context(s).
scopenote: This term is a blanket purpose category for indicating personalisation of some other purpose, e.g. by creating a subclass of the other concept and Personalisation;This term is a blanket purpose category for indicating personalisation of some other purpose, e.g. by creating a subclass of the other concept and Personalisation;This term is a blanket purpose category for indicating personalisation of some other purpose, e.g. by creating a subclass of the other concept and Personalisation

label: Personalised Advertising
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing personalised advertising

label: Personalised Benefits
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing personalised benefits for a service

label: Personnel Hiring
definition: Purposes associated with management and execution of hiring processes of personnel

label: Personnel Management
definition: Purposes associated with management of personnel associated with the organisation e.g. evaluation and management of employees and intermediaries

label: Personnel Payment
definition: Purposes associated with management and execution of payment of personnel

label: Physical Access Control Method
definition: Access control applied for physical access e.g. premises or equipment

label: Physical Authentication
definition: Physical implementation of authentication e.g. by matching the person to their ID card

label: Physical Authorisation
definition: Physical implementation of authorisation e.g. by stamping a visitor pass

label: Physical Device Security
definition: Physical protection for devices and equipment

label: Physical Interception Protection
definition: Physical protection against interception e.g. by posting a guard

label: Physical Interruption Protection
definition: Physical protection against interruptions e.g. electrical supply interruption

label: Physical Measure
definition: Physical measures used to safeguard and ensure good practices in connection with data and technologies

label: Physical Network Security
definition: Physical protection for networks and networking related infrastructure e.g. by isolating networking equipments

label: Physical Secure Storage
definition: Physical protection for storage of information or equipment e.g. secure storage for files

label: Physical Supply Security
definition: Physically securing the supply of resources

label: Physical Surveillance
definition: Physically monitoring areas via surveillance

label: Policy
definition: A guidance document outlining any of: procedures, plans, principles, decisions, intent, or protocols.

label: Post-Quantum Cryptography
definition: Use of algorithms that are intended to be secure against cryptanalytic attack by a quantum computer

label: Primary Importance
definition: Indication of 'primary' or 'main' or 'core' importance

label: Principle
definition: A representation of values or norms that must be taken into consideration when conducting activities

label: Privacy by Default
definition: Practices regarding setting the default configurations of information and services to implement data protection and privacy (synonymous with Data Protection by Default)

label: Privacy by Design
definition: Practices regarding incorporating data protection and privacy in the design of information and services (synonymous with Data Protection by Design)

label: Privacy Notice
definition: Represents a notice or document outlining information regarding privacy

label: Privacy Preserving Protocol
definition: Use of protocols designed with the intention of provided additional guarantees regarding privacy

label: Private Information Retrieval
definition: Use of cryptographic methods to retrieve a record from a system without revealing which record is retrieved

label: Private Location
definition: Location that is not or cannot be accessed by the public and is controlled as a private space

label: Processing
definition: Operations or 'processing' performed on data

label: Processing Condition
definition: Conditions required or followed regarding processing of data or use of technologies

label: Processing Context
definition: Context or conditions within which processing takes place

label: Processing Duration
definition: Conditinos regarding duration or temporal limitation for processing

label: Processing Location
definition: Conditions regarding location or geospatial scope where processing takes places

label: Processing Scale
definition: Scale of Processing
scopenote: The exact definition of what constitutes "scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending the scales provided with the appropriate context.;The exact definition of what constitutes "scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending the scales provided with the appropriate context.

label: Professional Training
definition: Training methods that are intended to provide professional knowledge and expertise

label: Profiling
definition: to create a profile that describes or represents a person

label: Prohibition
definition: A rule describing a prohibition to perform an activity

label: Provide Consent
definition: Control for providing consent
scopenote: Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the data subject can provide consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt

label: Provide Event Recommendations
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing personalised recommendations for events

label: Provide Personalised Recommendations
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing personalised recommendations

label: Provide Product Recommendations
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing product recommendations e.g. suggest similar products

label: ProvidedData
definition: Data that has been provided by an entity
scopenote: Provided data involves one entity explicitly providing the data, which the other entity then collects;Provided data involves one entity explicitly providing the data, which the other entity then collects

label: Provided Personal Data
definition: Personal Data that has been provided by an entity such as the Data Subject
scopenote: Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects;Provided personal data involves one entity (e.g. data subject) explicitly providing the data, which the other entity (e.g. data controller) then collects

label: Pseudonymisation
definition: Pseudonymisation means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person;

label: Pseudonymise
definition: to replace personal identifiable information by artificial identifiers

label: Pseudonymised Data
definition: Pseudonymised Data is data that has gone a partial or incomplete anonymisation process by replacing the identifiable information with artificial identifiers or 'pseudonyms', and is still considered as personal data

label: Public Data Source
definition: A source of data that is publicly accessible or available
scopenote: The term 'Public' is used here in a broad sense. Actual consideration of what is 'Public Data' can vary based on several contextual or jurisdictional factors such as  definition of open, methods of access, permissions and licenses.;The term 'Public' is used here in a broad sense. Actual consideration of what is 'Public Data' can vary based on several contextual or jurisdictional factors such as  definition of open, methods of access, permissions and licenses.;The term 'Public' is used here in a broad sense. Actual consideration of what is 'Public Data' can vary based on several contextual or jurisdictional factors such as  definition of open, methods of access, permissions and licenses.

label: Public Interest
definition: Activities are necessary or beneficial for interest of the public or society at large

label: Public Location
definition: Location that is or can be accessed by the public

label: Public Register of Entities
definition: A publicly available list of entities e.g. to indicate which entities perform a certain activity within a certain location or jurisdiction

label: Public Relations
definition: Purposes associated with managing and conducting public relations processes, including creating goodwill for the organisation

label: Purpose
definition: Purpose or (broader) Goal associated with data or technology
scopenote: The purpose or goal here is intended to sufficiently describe the intention or objective of why the data or technology is being used, and should be broader than mere technical descriptions of achieving a capability. For example, "Analyse Data" is an abstract purpose with no indication of what the analyses is for as compared to a purpose such as "Marketing" or "Service Provision" which provide clarity and comprehension of the 'purpose' and can be enhanced with additional descriptions. Such modelling is in line with regulatory requirements regarding the specificity of purposes, for example in GDPR;The purpose or goal here is intended to sufficiently describe the intention or objective of why the data or technology is being used, and should be broader than mere technical descriptions of achieving a capability. For example, "Analyse Data" is an abstract purpose with no indication of what the analyses is for as compared to a purpose such as "Marketing" or "Service Provision" which provide clarity and comprehension of the 'purpose' and can be enhanced with additional descriptions. Such modelling is in line with regulatory requirements regarding the specificity of purposes, for example in GDPR

label: Quantum Cryptography
definition: Cryptographic methods that utilise quantum mechanical properties to perform cryptographic tasks

label: Query
definition: to query or make enquiries over data

label: RNG Pseudonymisation
definition: A pseudonymisation method where identifiers are substituted by a number chosen by a Random Number Generator (RNG)

label: Records of Processing Activities
definition: A Record of Processing Activities (ROPA) is a document detailing processing activities
scopenote: ROPA under GDPR Art.30 has specific requirements regarding the information to be maintained. Additionally, Data Protection Authorities also provide additional information guidelines for information to be maintained in a ROPA. For more information see https://w3id.org/dpcat;ROPA under GDPR Art.30 has specific requirements regarding the information to be maintained. Additionally, Data Protection Authorities also provide additional information guidelines for information to be maintained in a ROPA. For more information see https://w3id.org/dpcat;ROPA under GDPR Art.30 has specific requirements regarding the information to be maintained. Additionally, Data Protection Authorities also provide additional information guidelines for information to be maintained in a ROPA. For more information see https://w3id.org/dpcat

label: Random Location
definition: Location that is random or unknown

label: Reaffirm Consent
definition: Control for affirming consent
scopenote: Indicates how the controller (with dpv:ObtainConsent) or data subject (with dpv:ProvideConsent) can reaffirm consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt;Indicates how the controller (with dpv:ObtainConsent) or data subject (with dpv:ProvideConsent) can reaffirm consent e.g. used with dpv:isExercisedAt

label: Re-certification Policy
definition: Policy regarding repetition or renewal of existing certification(s)

label: Recipient
definition: Entities that receive data or technologies
scopenote: Recipients that receive personal data can be a Third Party, Data Controller, or Data Processor.;Recipients that receive personal data can be a Third Party, Data Controller, or Data Processor.

label: Recipient Informed
definition: Status indicating Recipient has been informed about the specified context

label: Recipient Uninformed
definition: Status indicating Recipient is uninformed i.e. has not been informed about the specified context

label: Record
definition: to make a record (especially media)

label: Record Management
definition: Purposes associated with manage creation, storage, and use of records relevant to operations, events, and processes e.g. to store logs or access requests
scopenote: This purpose relates specifiaclly for record creation and management. This can be combined or used along with other purposes to express intentions such as records for legal compliance or vendor payments.;This purpose relates specifiaclly for record creation and management. This can be combined or used along with other purposes to express intentions such as records for legal compliance or vendor payments.;This purpose relates specifiaclly for record creation and management. This can be combined or used along with other purposes to express intentions such as records for legal compliance or vendor payments.

label: Records of Activities
definition: Records of activities within some context such as maintainence tasks or governance functions
scopenote: Records can be any information associated with the activity e.g. logs, summaries.;Records can be any information associated with the activity e.g. logs, summaries.;Records can be any information associated with the activity e.g. logs, summaries.

label: Reformat
definition: to rearrange or restructure data to change its form

label: Region
definition: A region is an area or site that is considered a location

label: Regional Authority
definition: An authority tasked with overseeing legal compliance for a region

label: Regional Scale
definition: Geographic coverage spanning a specific region or regions

label: Regulatory Sandbox
definition: Mechanism used by regulators and businesses for gauging the compatibility of regulations and innovative products, particularly in the context of digitalisation, in a controlled real-world environment with appropriate safeguards in place

label: Remote Location
definition: Location is remote i.e. not local

label: Remove
definition: to destruct or erase data

label: Renewed Consent Given
definition: The state where a previously given consent has been 'renewed' or 'refreshed' or 'reaffirmed' to form a new instance of given consent
scopenote: An example of this state is when a previously given consent has expired, and the individual is presented a notice regarding continuing associated processing operations - to which they agree. This state can be useful to keep track of 'reconfirmed' or 'refreshed' consent within consent records, assist notices and contextual agents to create better consenting dialogues, and assist with specific legal obligations related to subsequent consenting;An example of this state is when a previously given consent has expired, and the individual is presented a notice regarding continuing associated processing operations - to which they agree. This state can be useful to keep track of 'reconfirmed' or 'refreshed' consent within consent records, assist notices and contextual agents to create better consenting dialogues, and assist with specific legal obligations related to subsequent consenting;An example of this state is when a previously given consent has expired, and the individual is presented a notice regarding continuing associated processing operations - to which they agree. This state can be useful to keep track of 'reconfirmed' or 'refreshed' consent within consent records, assist notices and contextual agents to create better consenting dialogues, and assist with specific legal obligations related to subsequent consenting

label: Repair Impairments
definition: Purposes associated with identifying, rectifying, or otherwise undertaking activities intended to fix or repair impairments to existing functionalities
scopenote: An example of identifying and rectifying impairments is the process of finding and fixing errors in products, commonly referred to as debugging;An example of identifying and rectifying impairments is the process of finding and fixing errors in products, commonly referred to as debugging;An example of identifying and rectifying impairments is the process of finding and fixing errors in products, commonly referred to as debugging

label: Representative
definition: A representative of a legal entity

label: Request Accepted
definition: State of a request being accepted towards fulfilment

label: Request Acknowledged
definition: State of a request being acknowledged

label: Request Action Delayed
definition: State of a request being delayed towards fulfilment

label: Request Fulfilled
definition: State of a request being fulfilled

label: Request Initiated
definition: State of a request being initiated

label: Request Rejected
definition: State of a request being rejected towards non-fulfilment

label: Request Required Action Performed
definition: State of a request's required action having been performed by the other party

label: Request Requires Action
definition: State of a request requiring an action to be performed from another party

label: Request Status
definition: Status associated with requests

label: Request Status Query
definition: State of a request's status being queried

label: Request Unfulfilled
definition: State of a request being unfulfilled

label: Requested Service Provision
definition: Purposes associated with delivering services as requested by user or consumer
scopenote: The use of 'request' here includes where an user explicitly asks for the service and also when an established contract requires the provision of the service;The use of 'request' here includes where an user explicitly asks for the service and also when an established contract requires the provision of the service;The use of 'request' here includes where an user explicitly asks for the service and also when an established contract requires the provision of the service

label: Required
definition: Indication of 'required' or 'necessary'

label: Research and Development
definition: Purposes associated with conducting research and development for new methods, products, or services

label: Residual Risk
definition: Risk remaining after treatment or mitigation

label: Restrict
definition: to apply a restriction on the processing of specific records

label: Retrieve
definition: to retrieve data, often in an automated manner

label: Reversing Process Effects
definition: Involvement where entity can reverse effects of specified context
scopenote: Effects refer to consequences and impacts arising from the process or from the outputs of a process;Effects refer to consequences and impacts arising from the process or from the outputs of a process;Effects refer to consequences and impacts arising from the process or from the outputs of a process

label: Reversing Process Input
definition: Involvement where entity can reverse input of specified context
scopenote: Reversion can be considered a form of correction in some instances. We welcome inputs to further explore and define this relation between correction and reversion concepts.;Reversion can be considered a form of correction in some instances. We welcome inputs to further explore and define this relation between correction and reversion concepts.;Reversion can be considered a form of correction in some instances. We welcome inputs to further explore and define this relation between correction and reversion concepts.

label: Reversing Process Output
definition: Involvement where entity can reverse output of specified context
scopenote: Reversing of outputs indicate discarding the output and going back to the previous output. This is different from correction of output which allows modification of the output - implying continuation of the process.;Reversing of outputs indicate discarding the output and going back to the previous output. This is different from correction of output which allows modification of the output - implying continuation of the process.;Reversing of outputs indicate discarding the output and going back to the previous output. This is different from correction of output which allows modification of the output - implying continuation of the process.

label: Review Impact Assessment
definition: Procedures to review impact assessments in terms of continued validity, adequacy for intended purposes, and conformance of processes with findings

label: Review Procedure
definition: A procedure or process that reviews the correctness and validity of other procedures and policies e.g. to ensure continued validity, adequacy for intended purposes, and conformance of processes with findings

label: Right
definition: The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected
scopenote: A 'right' is a legal, social, or ethical principle of freedom or entitlement which dictate the norms regarding what is allowed or owed. Rights as a concept encompass a broad area of norms and entities, and are not specific to Individuals or Data Protection / Privacy. For individual specific rights, see dpv:DataSubjectRight;A 'right' is a legal, social, or ethical principle of freedom or entitlement which dictate the norms regarding what is allowed or owed. Rights as a concept encompass a broad area of norms and entities, and are not specific to Individuals or Data Protection / Privacy. For individual specific rights, see dpv:DataSubjectRight

label: Right Exercise Activity
definition: An activity representing an exercising of an active right
scopenote: There may be multiple activities associated with exercising and fulfilling rights. See the RightExerciseRecord concept for record-keeping of such activities in a cohesive manner.;There may be multiple activities associated with exercising and fulfilling rights. See the RightExerciseRecord concept for record-keeping of such activities in a cohesive manner.;There may be multiple activities associated with exercising and fulfilling rights. See the RightExerciseRecord concept for record-keeping of such activities in a cohesive manner.

label: Right Exercise Notice
definition: Information associated with exercising of an active right such as where and how to exercise the right, information required for it, or updates on an exercised rights request
scopenote: This concept is intended for providing information regarding a right exercise. For specific instances of such exercises, see RightExerciseActivity and RightExerciseRecord.;This concept is intended for providing information regarding a right exercise. For specific instances of such exercises, see RightExerciseActivity and RightExerciseRecord.;This concept is intended for providing information regarding a right exercise. For specific instances of such exercises, see RightExerciseActivity and RightExerciseRecord.

label: Right Exercise Record
definition: Record of a Right being exercised
scopenote: This concept represents a record of one or more right exercise activities, such as those associated with a single data subject or service or entity;This concept represents a record of one or more right exercise activities, such as those associated with a single data subject or service or entity;This concept represents a record of one or more right exercise activities, such as those associated with a single data subject or service or entity

label: Right Fulfilment Notice
definition: Notice provided regarding fulfilment of a right
scopenote: This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of progressing the fulfilment of a right. For example, a notice asking for more information regarding the scope of the right, or providing information on where to access the data provided under a right.;This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of progressing the fulfilment of a right. For example, a notice asking for more information regarding the scope of the right, or providing information on where to access the data provided under a right.;This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of progressing the fulfilment of a right. For example, a notice asking for more information regarding the scope of the right, or providing information on where to access the data provided under a right.

label: Right Non-Fulfilment Notice
definition: Notice provided regarding non-fulfilment of a right
scopenote: This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of communicating non-fulfilment of a right. For example, to provide justifications on why a right could not be fulfilled or providing information about another entity  who should be approached for exercising this right.;This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of communicating non-fulfilment of a right. For example, to provide justifications on why a right could not be fulfilled or providing information about another entity  who should be approached for exercising this right.;This notice is associated with situations where information is provided with the intention of communicating non-fulfilment of a right. For example, to provide justifications on why a right could not be fulfilled or providing information about another entity  who should be approached for exercising this right.

label: Right Notice
definition: Information associated with rights, such as which rights exist, when and where they are applicable, and other relevant information
scopenote: This concept also covers information about rights exercise, with dpv:RightExerciseNotice specifically representing information provided in connection with exercising of rights. Both notices may be needed, e.g. RightNotice for providing information about existence and exercise of rights, and RightExerciseNotice for providing additional information specifically about exericse of rights - such as to request more information or provide updates on an exercised rights request;This concept also covers information about rights exercise, with dpv:RightExerciseNotice specifically representing information provided in connection with exercising of rights. Both notices may be needed, e.g. RightNotice for providing information about existence and exercise of rights, and RightExerciseNotice for providing additional information specifically about exericse of rights - such as to request more information or provide updates on an exercised rights request;This concept also covers information about rights exercise, with dpv:RightExerciseNotice specifically representing information provided in connection with exercising of rights. Both notices may be needed, e.g. RightNotice for providing information about existence and exercise of rights, and RightExerciseNotice for providing additional information specifically about exericse of rights - such as to request more information or provide updates on an exercised rights request

label: Rights Fulfillment
definition: Purposes associated with the fulfillment of rights specified in law
scopenote: Where Rights Fulfillment includes activities that are not legal obligations, for example conducting Identity Verification, the documentation should indicate this by expressing them as separate purposes within the same activity;Where Rights Fulfillment includes activities that are not legal obligations, for example conducting Identity Verification, the documentation should indicate this by expressing them as separate purposes within the same activity;Where Rights Fulfillment includes activities that are not legal obligations, for example conducting Identity Verification, the documentation should indicate this by expressing them as separate purposes within the same activity

label: Rights Impact Assessment
definition: Impact assessment which involves determining the impact on rights and freedoms
scopenote: The rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction;The rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction;The rights and freedoms may be those defined in law or other norms, and may be bound to a jurisdiction

label: Rights Management
definition: Methods associated with rights management where 'rights' refer to controlling who can do what with a resource

label: Risk
definition: A risk or possibility or uncertainty of negative effects, impacts, or consequences
scopenote: Risks can be associated with one or more different concepts such as purpose, processing, personal data, technical or organisational measure;Risks can be associated with one or more different concepts such as purpose, processing, personal data, technical or organisational measure

label: Risk Assessment
definition: Assessment involving identification, analysis, and evaluation of risk

label: Risk Level
definition: The magnitude of a risk expressed as an indication to aid in its management
scopenote: Risk Levels can be defined as a combination of different characteristics. For example, ISO 31073:2022 defines it as a combination of consequences and their likelihood. Another example would be the Risk Matrix where Risk Level is defined as a combination of Likelihood and Severity associated with the Risk.;Risk Levels can be defined as a combination of different characteristics. For example, ISO 31073:2022 defines it as a combination of consequences and their likelihood. Another example would be the Risk Matrix where Risk Level is defined as a combination of Likelihood and Severity associated with the Risk.

label: Risk Mitigation Measure
definition: Measures intended to mitigate, minimise, or prevent risk.

label: Rule
definition: A rule describing a process or control that directs or determines if and how an activity should be conducted

label: Safeguard
definition: A safeguard is a precautionary measure for the protection against or mitigation of negative effects
scopenote: This concept is relevant given the requirement to assert safeguards in cross-border data transfers;This concept is relevant given the requirement to assert safeguards in cross-border data transfers;This concept is relevant given the requirement to assert safeguards in cross-border data transfers

label: Safeguard for Data Transfer
definition: Represents a safeguard used for data transfer. Can include technical or organisational measures.

label: Scale
definition: A measurement along some dimension
scopenote: Scales are subjective concepts that need to be defined and interpreted within the context of their application. For example, what would be small within one context could be large within another.;Scales are subjective concepts that need to be defined and interpreted within the context of their application. For example, what would be small within one context could be large within another.

label: Scope
definition: Indication of the extent or range or boundaries associated with(in) a context

label: Scoring of Individuals
definition: Processing that involves scoring of individuals

label: Screen
definition: to remove data for some criteria

label: Seal
definition: A seal or a mark indicating proof of certification to some certification or standard

label: Search Functionalities
definition: Purposes associated with providing searching, querying, or other forms of information retrieval related functionalities

label: Secondary Importance
definition: Indication of 'secondary' or 'minor' or 'auxiliary' importance

label: Secret Sharing Schemes
definition: Use of secret sharing schemes where the secret can only be reconstructed through combination of sufficient number of individuals

label: Sector
definition: Sector describes the area of application or domain that indicates or restricts scope for interpretation and application of purpose e.g. Agriculture, Banking
scopenote: There are various sector codes used commonly to indicate the domain of an organisation or business. Examples include NACE (EU), ISIC (UN), SIC and NAICS (USA).;There are various sector codes used commonly to indicate the domain of an organisation or business. Examples include NACE (EU), ISIC (UN), SIC and NAICS (USA).

label: Secure Multi-Party Computation
definition: Use of cryptographic methods for entities to jointly compute functions without revealing inputs

label: Secure Processing Environment
definition: A physical or virtual environment supported by organisational means that integrates security and compliance requirements and allows supervising data processing actions

label: Security Assessment
definition: Assessment of security intended to identity gaps, vulnerabilities, risks, and effectiveness of controls

label: Security Incident Notice
definition: A notice providing information about security incident(s)

label: Security Incident Notification
definition: Notification of information about security incident(s)

label: Security Incident Record
definition: Record of a security incident

label: Security Knowledge Training
definition: Training intended to increase knowledge regarding security

label: Security Method
definition: Methods that relate to creating and providing security

label: Security Procedure
definition: Procedures associated with assessing, implementing, and evaluating security

label: Security Role Procedures
definition: Procedures related to security roles

definition: Purposes associated with selling products or services

label: Sell Products to Data Subject
definition: Purposes associated with selling products or services to the user, consumer, or data subjects

It should not be confused with providing services with a cost based on an established agreement.;Sell Products here refers to processing necessary to provide and complete a sale to customers. It should not be confused with providing services with a cost based on an established agreement.;Sell Products here refers to processing necessary to provide and complete a sale to customers.
