label: Sensitive Personal Data
definition: Personal data that is considered 'sensitive' in terms of privacy and/or impact, and therefore requires additional considerations and/or protection
scopenote: Sensitivity' is a matter of context, and may be defined within legal frameworks. For GDPR, Special categories of personal data are considered a subset of sensitive data. To illustrate the difference between the two, consider the situation where Location data is collected, and which is considered 'sensitive' but not 'special'. As a probable rule, sensitive data require additional considerations whereas special category data requires additional legal basis / justifications.;Sensitivity' is a matter of context, and may be defined within legal frameworks. For GDPR, Special categories of personal data are considered a subset of sensitive data. To illustrate the difference between the two, consider the situation where Location data is collected, and which is considered 'sensitive' but not 'special'. As a probable rule, sensitive data require additional considerations whereas special category data requires additional legal basis / justifications.

label: Sensitivity Level
definition: Sensitivity' reflects the risk of impact if not secured or utilised with appropriate measures and controls e.g. for sensitive data
scopenote: ISO/IEC TS 38505-3:2021 defines 'data sensitivity' as the potential harm of unauthorised disclosure. DPV's use of the concept goes beyond disclosure as it refers to the level of safeguards or controls the data requires as a reflection of its 'sensitive' nature. To indicate quantified levels of sensitivity, e.g. "high sensitivity", instances of severity can be directly used or specialised;ISO/IEC TS 38505-3:2021 defines 'data sensitivity' as the potential harm of unauthorised disclosure. DPV's use of the concept goes beyond disclosure as it refers to the level of safeguards or controls the data requires as a reflection of its 'sensitive' nature. To indicate quantified levels of sensitivity, e.g. "high sensitivity", instances of severity can be directly used or specialised

label: Service Consumer
definition: The entity that consumes or receives the service

label: Service Optimisation
definition: Purposes associated with optimisation of services or activities
scopenote: Subclass of ServiceProvision since optimisation is usually considered part of providing services;Subclass of ServiceProvision since optimisation is usually considered part of providing services;Subclass of ServiceProvision since optimisation is usually considered part of providing services

label: Service Personalisation
definition: Purposes associated with providing personalisation within services or product or activities

label: Service Provider
definition: The entity that provides a service

label: Service Provision
definition: Purposes associated with providing service or product or activities

label: Service Registration
definition: Purposes associated with registering users and collecting information required for providing a service
scopenote: An example of service registration is to provide a form that collects information such as preferred language or media format for downloading a movie;An example of service registration is to provide a form that collects information such as preferred language or media format for downloading a movie;An example of service registration is to provide a form that collects information such as preferred language or media format for downloading a movie

label: Service Usage Analytics
definition: Purposes associated with conducting analysis and reporting related to usage of services or products
scopenote: Was "UsageAnalytics", prefixed with Service to better reflect scope;Was "UsageAnalytics", prefixed with Service to better reflect scope;Was "UsageAnalytics", prefixed with Service to better reflect scope

label: Severity
definition: The magnitude of being unwanted or having negative effects such as harmful impacts
scopenote: Severity can be associated with Risk, or its Consequences and Impacts;Severity can be associated with Risk, or its Consequences and Impacts

label: Share
definition: to give data (or a portion of it) to others

label: Single Sign On
definition: Use of credentials or processes that enable using one set of credentials to authenticate multiple contexts.

label: Singular Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered singular i.e. a specific instance or single item

label: Singular Frequency
definition: Frequency where occurences are singular i.e. they take place only once

label: Singular Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered singular i.e. a specific data subject

label: Small Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered small or limited within the context

label: Small Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered small or limited within the context

label: Small Scale Processing
definition: Processing that takes place at small scales (as specified by some criteria)

label: Social Media Marketing
definition: Purposes associated with conducting marketing through social media

label: Special Category Personal Data
definition: Sensitive Personal Data whose use requires specific additional legal permission or justification
scopenote: The term 'special category' is based on GDPR Art.9, but should not be considered as exlusive to it. DPV considers all Special Categories to also be Sensitive, but whose use is either prohibited or regulated and therefore requires additional legal basis for justification that is separate from that for general personal data.;The term 'special category' is based on GDPR Art.9, but should not be considered as exlusive to it. DPV considers all Special Categories to also be Sensitive, but whose use is either prohibited or regulated and therefore requires additional legal basis for justification that is separate from that for general personal data.

label: Sporadic Data Volume
definition: Data volume that is considered sporadic or sparse within the context

label: Sporadic Frequency
definition: Frequency where occurences are sporadic or infrequent or sparse

label: Sporadic Scale Of Data Subjects
definition: Scale of data subjects considered sporadic or sparse within the context

label: Staff Training
definition: Practices and policies regarding training of staff members

label: Standards Conformance
definition: Purposes associated with activities undertaken to ensure or achieve conformance with standards

label: Status
definition: The status or state of something

label: Storage Condition
definition: Conditions required or followed regarding storage of data

label: Storage Deletion
definition: Deletion or Erasure of data including any deletion guarantees

label: Storage Duration
definition: Duration or temporal limitation on storage of data

label: Storage Location
definition: Location or geospatial scope where the data is stored

label: Storage Restoration
definition: Regularity and temporal span of data restoration/backup mechanisms that guarantee that data is preserved

label: Store
definition: to keep data for future use

label: Structure
definition: to arrange data according to a structure

label: Student
definition: Data subjects that are students

label: Sub-Processor Agreement
definition: An agreement outlining conditions, criteria, obligations, responsibilities, and specifics for carrying out processing of data between a Data Processor and a Data (Sub-)Processor

label: Subscriber
definition: Data subjects that subscribe to service(s)
scopenote: note: subscriber can be customer or consumer;note: subscriber can be customer or consumer;note: subscriber can be customer or consumer

label: Subsidiary Legal Entity
definition: A legal entity that operates as a subsidiary of another legal entity

label: Support Contract Negotiation
definition: Supporting entities, including individuals, with negotiating a contract and its terms and conditions

label: Support Entity Decision Making
definition: Supporting entities, including individuals, in making decisions

label: Support Exchange of Views
definition: Supporting inviduals and entities in exchanging views e.g. regarding data processing purposes for their best interests

label: Support Informed Consent Decision
definition: Supporting individuals with making a decision regarding their informed consent

label: Supra-National Authority
definition: An authority tasked with overseeing legal compliance for a supra-national union e.g. EU

label: Supranational Union
definition: A political union of two or more countries with an establishment of common authority

label: Symmetric Cryptography
definition: Use of cryptography where the same keys are utilised for encryption and decryption of information

label: Symmetric Encryption
definition: Use of symmetric cryptography to encrypt data

label: Synthetic Data
definition: Synthetic data reffers to artificially created data such that it is intended to resemble real data (personal or non-personal), but does not refer to any specific identified or identifiable individual, or to the real measure of an observable parameter in the case of non-personal data

label: Systematic Monitoring
definition: Processing that involves systematic monitoring of individuals

label: Targeted Advertising
definition: Purposes associated with creating and providing pesonalised advertisement where the personalisation is targeted to a specific individual or group of individuals

label: Technical Measure
definition: Technical measures used to safeguard and ensure good practices in connection with data and technologies

label: Technical and Organisational Measure
definition: Technical and Organisational measures used to safeguard and ensure good practices in connection with data and technologies

label: Technical Service Provision
definition: Purposes associated with managing and providing technical processes and functions necessary for delivering services

label: Technology
definition: The technology, technological implementation, or any techniques, skills, methods, and processes used or applied
scopenote: Examples (non-exhaustive) include: Algorithm, Process, Method, Skill, Database, Cookies, Server, Device;Examples (non-exhaustive) include: Algorithm, Process, Method, Skill, Database, Cookies, Server, Device

label: Temporal Duration
definition: Duration that has a fixed temporal duration e.g. 6 months

label: Third Country
definition: Represents a country outside applicable or compatible jurisdiction as outlined in law

label: Third Party
definition: A ‘third party’ means any natural or legal person other than - the entities directly involved or operating under those directly involved in a process
scopenote: Third Party in the context of personal data processing are entities other than the data subject, controllers, processors, and authorities;Third Party in the context of personal data processing are entities other than the data subject, controllers, processors, and authorities

label: Third-Party Agreement
definition: An agreement outlining conditions, criteria, obligations, responsibilities, and specifics for carrying out processing of data between a Data Controller or Processor and a Third Party

label: Third Party Contract
definition: Creation, completion, fulfilment, or performance of a contract, with the Data Controller and Third Party as parties, and involving specified processing of data or technologies

label: ThirdParty as Data Source
definition: Data Sourced from a Third Party, e.g. when data is collected from an entity that is neither the Controller nor the Data Subject

label: Third Party Security Procedures
definition: Procedures related to security associated with Third Parties

label: Tourist
definition: Data subjects that are tourists i.e. not citizens and not immigrants

label: Transfer
definition: to move data from one place to another

label: Transform
definition: to change the form or nature of data

label: Transmit
definition: to send out data

label: Trusted Computing
definition: Use of cryptographic methods to restrict access and execution to trusted parties and code

label: Trusted Execution Environment
definition: Use of cryptographic methods to restrict access and execution to trusted parties and code within a dedicated execution environment

label: Unexpected
definition: Status indicating the specified context was unexpected i.e. not expected

label: Uninformed Consent
definition: Consent that is uninformed i.e. without requirement to provide sufficient information to make a consenting decision

label: Unintended
definition: Status indicating the specified context was unintended i.e. not intended

label: Unknown Applicability
definition: Concept indicating information or context availability is unknown i.e. it is not known if the information exists or is applicable and therefore statements about its availability cannot be made (yet)
scopenote: This concept is useful when describing situations where it cannot be stated whether the context applies or whether the information is not available yet. For example, if a form field asks about whether a process X was completed and it is not yet known whether X applies or not and therefore it is also unclear whether X was completed or not. Using UnknownApplicability is a signal that the applicability of X should be assessed, and if applicable, then information about X should be identified and used here.;This concept is useful when describing situations where it cannot be stated whether the context applies or whether the information is not available yet. For example, if a form field asks about whether a process X was completed and it is not yet known whether X applies or not and therefore it is also unclear whether X was completed or not. Using UnknownApplicability is a signal that the applicability of X should be assessed, and if applicable, then information about X should be identified and used here.;This concept is useful when describing situations where it cannot be stated whether the context applies or whether the information is not available yet. For example, if a form field asks about whether a process X was completed and it is not yet known whether X applies or not and therefore it is also unclear whether X was completed or not. Using UnknownApplicability is a signal that the applicability of X should be assessed, and if applicable, then information about X should be identified and used here.

label: Unlawful
definition: State of being unlawful or legally non-compliant

label: Until Event Duration
definition: Duration that takes place until a specific event occurs e.g. Account Closure

label: Until Time Duration
definition: Duration that has a fixed end date e.g. 2022-12-31

label: Unverified Data
definition: Data that has not been verified in terms of accuracy, inconsistency, or quality

label: Usage Control
definition: Management of usage, which is intended to be broader than access control and may cover trust, digital rights, or other relevant controls

label: Use
definition: to use data

label: Use of Synthetic Data
definition: Use of synthetic data to preserve privacy, security, or other effects and side-effects

label: User
definition: Data subjects that use service(s)

label: User Interface Personalisation
definition: Purposes associated with personalisation of interfaces presented to the user

label: Variable Location
definition: Location that is known but is variable e.g. somewhere within a given area

definition: Indicates information about storage condition

label: has subsidiary
definition: Indicates this entity has the specified entity as its subsidiary

label: has technical measure
definition: Indicates use or applicability of Technical measure

label: has technical and organisational measure
definition: Indicates use or applicability of Technical or Organisational measure

label: has third country
definition: Indicates applicability or relevance of a 'third country'

label: is after
definition: Indicates the specified concepts is 'after' this concept in some context
scopenote: Specifying a RightExerciseActivity occurs before another RightExerciseActivity;Specifying a RightExerciseActivity occurs before another RightExerciseActivity

label: is applicable for
definition: Indicates the concept or information is applicable for specified context

label: is authority for
definition: Indicates area, scope, or applicability of an Authority

label: is before
definition: Indicates the specified concepts is 'before' this concept in some context
scopenote: Specifying a RightExerciseActivity occurs before another RightExerciseActivity;Specifying a RightExerciseActivity occurs before another RightExerciseActivity

label: is determined by entity
definition: Indicates the context is determined by the specified entity

label: is exercised at
definition: Indicates context or information about exercising a right

label: is implemented by entity
definition: Indicates implementation details such as entities or agents
scopenote: The use of 'entity' is inclusive of entities (e.g. Data Processor) as well as 'agent' (e.g. DPO). For indicating technological implementation, the property isImplementedByTechnology should be used.;Indicates the Entity that implements or performs a Right Exercise Activity;The use of 'entity' is inclusive of entities (e.g. Data Processor) as well as 'agent' (e.g. DPO). For indicating technological implementation, the property isImplementedByTechnology should be used.;Indicates the Entity that implements or performs a Right Exercise Activity

label: is implemented using technology
definition: Indicates implementation details such as technologies or processes
scopenote: The term 'technology' is inclusive of technologies, processes, and methods.;The term 'technology' is inclusive of technologies, processes, and methods.

label: is indicated at time
definition: Specifies the temporal information for when the entity has indicated the specific context

label: is indicated by
definition: Specifies entity who indicates the specific context

label: is mitigated by measure
definition: Indicate a risk is mitigated by specified measure

label: is not applicable for
definition: Indicates the concept or information is not applicable for specified context

label: is organisational unit of
definition: Indicates this entity is an organisational unit of the specified entity

label: is policy for
definition: Indicates the context or application of policy

label: is representative for
definition: Indicates the entity is a representative for specified entity

label: is residual risk of
definition: Indicates this risk is the remaining or residual risk from applying mitigation measures or treatments to specified risk

label: is subsidiary of
definition: Indicates this entity is the subsidiary of the specified entity

label: mitigates risk
definition: Indicates risks mitigated by this concept

label: supports Compliance With
definition: Indicate the measure is required for meeting specified requirement or satisfying specified condition/constraint

label: Function

scopenote: Function is a broad concept that can include purposes such as identify verification, capability such as image recognition, or specific security measures such as encryption;Function is a broad concept that can include purposes such as identify verification, capability such as image recognition, or specific security measures such as encryption

label: Intended Use
definition: Describes the 'intended' use of the technology
scopenote: Intended use can be used to describe how the developer or provider of technology intends it to be used e.g. use a database to store data, and to describe the plan or 'intent' to use the technology by a user or operator e.g. use a database to store and analyse data. Intended Use can involve any concept e.g. DPV's purpose, processing, tech/org measures, and can be low-level purely technical uses such as store data or high-level goals such as legal compliance. Intended Use only describes the intent or ex-ante intention, and may be different from how the technology is being actually used - which is indicated by using isImplementedUsingTechnology in a procss or other relevant context.;Intended use can be used to describe how the developer or provider of technology intends it to be used e.g. use a database to store data, and to describe the plan or 'intent' to use the technology by a user or operator e.g. use a database to store and analyse data. label: AI System
definition: OECD 2024 definition: An AI system is a machine-based system that, for explicit or implicit objectives, infers, from the input it receives, how to generate outputs such as predictions, content, recommendations, or decisions that can influence physical or virtual environments. Different AI systems vary in their levels of autonomy and adaptiveness after deployment. label: Risk Matrix 3x3
definition: A Risk Matrix with 3 Likelihood, 3 Severity, and 3 Risk Level types

label: Risk Matrix 5x5
definition: A Risk Matrix with 5 Likelihood, 5 Severity, and 5 Risk Level types

label: Risk Matrix 7x7
definition: A Risk Matrix with 7 Likelihood, 7 Severity, and 7 Risk Level types

label: Avoid Source
definition: Control that avoids the risk source

label: Change Consequence
definition: Control that changes Consequence

label: Change Impact
definition: Control that changes Impact

label: Consequence Control
definition: Risk Mitigation Measure that controls the Consequences

label: Containment Control
definition: Control to contain event

label: Detection Control
definition: Control to detect event

label: Halt Source
definition: Control that halts the risk source or prevents it from materialising

label: Identification Control
definition: Control to identify characteristics of event

label: Impact Control
definition: Risk Mitigation Measure that controls Impacts

label: Monitor Consequence
definition: Control that monitors a Risk Consequence

label: Monitor Control
definition: Risk Mitigation Measure that uses controls to monitor events
scopenote: Monitoring can be associated with characteristics such as assessing or detecting whether something is active, operational, performant, effective, has potential to materialise, is materialising, or has already materialised.;Monitoring can be associated with characteristics such as assessing or detecting whether something is active, operational, performant, effective, has potential to materialise, is materialising, or has already materialised.;Monitoring can be associated with characteristics such as assessing or detecting whether something is active, operational, performant, effective, has potential to materialise, is materialising, or has already materialised.

label: Monitor Impact
definition: Control that monitors a Risk Impact

label: Monitor Risk
definition: Control that monitors a Risk

label: Monitor Control
definition: Control that monitors another Control

label: Monitor Risk Source
definition: Control that monitors a Risk Source

label: Monitor Vulnerabilities
definition: Control that monitors a Risk Vulnerability

label: Recovery Control
definition: Control to recover from event

label: Reduce Likelihood
definition: Control that reduces the likelihood of an event

label: Reduce Severity
definition: Control that reduces the severity of an event

label: Reduction Control
definition: Control that reduces the likelihood or severity of an event

label: Remedy Control
definition: Control to remedy consequences of event

label: Remove Consequence
definition: Control that removes Consequence i.e. prevents it from materialising

label: Remove Impact
definition: Control that removes Impact i.e. prevents it from materialising

label: Remove Source
definition: Control that removes the risk source

label: Risk Control
definition: Control that modifies risk

label: Share Risk
definition: Risk Mitigation Measure that shares Risk e.g. amongst stakeholders

label: Source Control
definition: Risk Mitigation Measure that controls the Source

label: Benefit
definition: Impact(s) that acts as or causes benefits

label: Compensation
definition: Compensation provided (as an impact)

label: Cryptojacking
definition: Cryptojacking or hidden cryptomining is a type of cybercrime where a criminal secretly uses a victim’s computing power to generate cryptocurrency

label: Damage
definition: Impact that acts as or causes damages

label: Detriment
definition: Impact that acts as or causes detriments

label: Fee
definition: Fee provided as compensation (as an impact)

label: Harm
definition: Impact that acts as or causes harms

label: Malicious Code Attack
definition: Intentional use of software by including or inserting in a system for a harmful purpose

label: Malware Attack
definition: Malware is software or firmware intended to perform an unauthorised process that will have an adverse impact on the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of a system

label: Material Damage
definition: Impact that acts as or causes material damages

label: MisinformationDisinformation
definition: Information that is untrue, misleading, or false and used intentionally (disinformation) or unintentionally (misinformation)

label: Non-Material Damage
definition: Impact that acts as or causes non-material damages

label: Payment
definition: Payment provided as compensation (as an impact)

label: Phishing Scam
definition: A type of social engineering attack involving deceptive messages intended to reveal sensitive information

label: RansomwareAttack
definition: Ransomware is a type of attack where threat actors take control of a target’s assets and demand a ransom in exchange for the return of the asset’s availability and confidentiality

label: Renumeration
definition: Renumeration provided as compensation (as an impact)

label: Reward
definition: Reward provided as compensation (as an impact)

label: Accidental Incident
definition: Incident caused due to accidental actions arising from human or human-controlled situations

label: Availability Incident
definition: Incident where the availability of information or system has been affected

label: Cofidentiality Incident
definition: Incident where the confidentiality of information or system has been affected

label: Cross-Border Incident
definition: Incident involving cross-border or multiple jurisdictions

label: Deliberate Incident
definition: Incident caused due to deliberate actions of a human

label: Evironmental Incident
definition: Incident caused due to environmental factors outside human controls

label: Incident Assessment Report
definition: A report describing the assessment of an incident in terms of its effects or impacts

label: Incident Concluding Report
definition: A report describing the conclusion of an investigation regarding a Incident where all relevant facts are known

label: Incident Detection Report
definition: A report describing the detection of a Incident

label: Incident Handling Report
definition: A report describing the response to or handling of an incident regarding the mitigation of its effects and the prevention of its recurrence

label: Incident Identifier
definition: Identifier associated with an incident

label: Incident Impact Assessment
definition: An impact assessment associated with a incident

label: Incident Mitigation Measure
definition: A mitigation measure taken in response specifically to mitigate an incident and prevent it from occuring again

label: Incident Notice
definition: Notice associated with an Incident

label: Incident Ongoing Report
definition: A report describing on ongoing investigation regarding a Incident where facts and extent of the investigation are being investigated

label: Incident Preliminary Report
definition: A report describing the preliminary investigation regarding a Incident where the complete facts or extent of the incident may not be known

label: Incident Register
definition: A register recording incidentes, their reports, notifications, and other related activities

label: Incident Report
definition: Documented information about an incident, its handling, assessments,and notifications

label: Incident Suspected Report
definition: A report describing the suspicion of an incident in the past or occuring

label: Integrity Incident
definition: Incident where the integrity of information or system has been affected

definition: Legal basis based on data subject's given explicit consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes

label: Art.6(1-a) regular consent
definition: Legal basis based on data subject's given non-explicit express consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes
scopenote: Definition of consent: A data subject's unambigious/clear affirmative action that signifies an agreement to process their personal data (Rigo Wenning) . What is referred to as 'non-explicit consent' here is also termed as 'regular' consent in the Article 29 Working Party document "Guidelines on Consent under Regulation 2016/679 (wp259rev.01)". This is the legal basis that requires consent but not at the level of being 'explicit'.;Definition of consent: A data subject's unambigious/clear affirmative action that signifies an agreement to process their personal data (Rigo Wenning) . What is referred to as 'non-explicit consent' here is also termed as 'regular' consent in the Article 29 Working Party document "Guidelines on Consent under Regulation 2016/679 (wp259rev.01)". label: Art 6(1-b) contract
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract

label: Art 6(1-b) contract performance
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a contract to which the data subject is party

label: Art 6(1-b) enter into contract
definition: Legal basis based on taking steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract

label: Art 6(1-c) legal obligation
definition: Legal basis based on compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests of data subject
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of the data subject

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests of natural person
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of another natural person that is not the data subject

label: Art 6(1-e) public interest or official authority
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller

label: Art 6(1-e) official authority
definition: Legal basis based on the exercise of official authority vested in the controller

label: Art 6(1-e) public interest
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a task carried out in the public interest

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest of controller
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest of third party
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: Art 9(2-a) explicit consent
definition: explicit consent with special categories of data

label: Art 9(2-b) employment, social security, social protection law
definition: employment and social security and social protection law

label: Art 9(2-c) protect vital interest
definition: protection of the vital interests

label: Art 9(2-d) legitimate activities
definition: legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects;

label: Art 9(2-e) data made public
definition: data manifestly made public by the data subject

label: Art 9(2-f) judicial process
definition: establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims / courts acting in their judicial capacity

label: Art 9(2-g) public interest
definition: substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law

label: Art 9(2-h) health & medicine
definition: preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3

label: Art 9(2-i) public interest in public health
definition: public interest in public health

label: Art 9(2-j) public interest, scientific research, statistical purpose
definition: public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes based on Union or Member State law

label: A13 Right to be Informed
definition: information to be provided where personal data is directly collected from data subject

label: A14 Right to be Informed
definition: information to be provided where personal data is collected from other sources

label: A15 Right of Access
definition: Right of access

label: A16 Right to Rectification
definition: Right to rectification

label: A17 Right to Erasure
definition: Right to erasure ('Right to be forgotten')

label: A18 Right to Restrict Processing
definition: Right to restriction of processing

label: A19 Right to Rectification Notification
definition: Right to be notified in case of rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing

label: A20 Right to Data Portability
definition: Right to data portability

label: A21 Right to object
definition: Right to object to processing of personal data

label: A22 Right to object to automated decision making
definition: Right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing including profiling

label: A7-3 Right to Withdraw Consent
definition: Right to withdraw consent at any time

label: A77 Right to Complaint
definition: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

label: Direct Data Collection Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.13 regarding information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject

label: Indirect Data Collection Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.14 regarding information to be provided where personal data are not collected from the data subject

label: Rights Recipients Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.19 regarding Recipients to whom a rights exercise has been communicated, such as regarding rectification (A.16) or erasure of personal data (A.17) or restriction of processing (A.18)

label: SAR Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.15 regarding information to be provided for Right of Access or Subject Access Request (SAR)

label: AdHoc Contractual Clauses
definition: Contractual Clauses not drafted by the EU Commission, e.g. by the Controller

label: Binding Corporate Rules (BCR)
definition: Binding corporate rules (BCR) are data protection policies adhered to by companies established in the EU for transfers of personal data outside the EU within a group of undertakings or enterprises.

label: Certification Mechanisms for Data Transfers
definition: Certification and its binding or specified mechanisms intended to provide sufficient safeguards for data transfers

label: Codes of Conduct for Data Transfers
definition: Codes of Conduct that outline sufficient safeguards for carrying out data transfers

label: Data Transfer Tool
definition: A legal instrument or tool intended to assist or justify data transfers

label: SCCs adopted by Commission
definition: Standard contractual clauses adopted by the Commission in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in GDPR Article 93(2)

label: SCCs adopted by Supervisory Authority
definition: Standard data protection clauses adopted by a supervisory authority and approved by the Commission pursuant to the examination procedure referred to in GDPR Article 93(2)

label: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC)
definition: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) are pre-approved clauses by the EU for ensuring appropriate data protection safeguards intended for data transfers from the EU to third countries

label: Supplementary Measure
definition: Supplementary measures are intended to additionally provide safeguards or guarentees to bring the resulting protection in line with EU requirements

label: DPIA Conformant
definition: Expressing the specified process is conformant with a DPIA

label: DPIA Conformity
definition: Conformity of a process with a DPIA

label: DPIA Indicates High Risk
definition: DPIA identifying high risk levels

label: DPIA Indicates Low Risk
definition: DPIA identifying low risk levels

label: DPIA Indicates No Risk
definition: DPIA identifying no risk is present

label: DPIA Necessity Assessment
definition: Process that determines whether a DPIA is necessary

label: DPIA Necessity Status
definition: Status reflecting whether a DPIA is necessary

label: DPIA Non-Conformant
definition: Expressing the specified process is not conformant with a DPIA

label: DPIA Not Required
definition: Condition where a DPIA is not required

label: DPIA Outcome
definition: Process representing determining outcome of a DPIA

label: DPIA Outcome DPA Consultation
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating a DPA consultation is required

label: DPIA Outcome High Residual Risk
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating high residual risk which are not acceptable for continuation

label: DPIA Outcome Risks Acceptable
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating residual risks remain and are acceptable for continuation

label: DPIA Outcome Risks Mitigated
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating (all) risks have been mitigated

label: DPIA Outcome Status
definition: Status reflecting the outcomes of a DPIA

label: DPIA Procedure
definition: Process representing carrying out a DPIA

label: DPIA Processing Recommendation
definition: Recommendation from the DPIA regarding processing

label: DPIA Recommends Processing Continue
definition: Recommendation from a DPIA that the processing may continue

label: DPIA Recommends Processing Not Continue
definition: Recommendation from a DPIA that the processing should not continue

label: DPIA Required
definition: Condition where a DPIA is required

label: DPIA Risk Status
definition: Status reflecting the status of risk associated with a DPIA

label: Availability Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an accidental or unauthorised loss of access to or destruction of personal data

label: Breach Notification Not Needed
definition: Data Breach notifications to DPA or Data Subjects are not required

label: Confidentiality Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an unauthorised or accidental disclosure of or access to personal data

label: Controller Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Controller

label: Controller Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Controller is required

label: Cross-Border Data Breach
definition: A data breach involving cross-border data subjects or processing operations

label: DBIA Indicates High Risk
definition: DBIA identifying high risk levels regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Indicates Low Risk
definition: DBIA identifying low risk levels regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Indicates No Risk
definition: DBIA identifying no risk is present regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Risk Status
definition: Status reflecting the status of risk associated with a DBIA regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DPA Breach Initial Notice
definition: Notice sent by a Controller within 72 hours of becoming aware of a personal data breach to the competent DPA, with justifications provided where the notice is made after 72 hours

label: DPA Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the DPA

label: DPA Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the DPA is required

label: DPA Bundled Breach Notice
definition: Notice sent by a Controller to the DPA regarding multiple data breaches concerning the same type of personal data

label: DPA Phased Breach Notice
definition: Notice sent to a DPA in phases i.e. by providing incremental information as it becomes available or is requested following previously submitted notifications

label: Data Breach
definition: A breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed
scopenote: GDPR's notion of data breach includes any incident that affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data and its processing without distinguishing between internal or external actors involved in the incident;GDPR's notion of data breach includes any incident that affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data and its processing without distinguishing between internal or external actors involved in the incident

label: Data Breach Concluding Report
definition: Documented information about a concluded data breach incident

label: Data Breach Detection Report
definition: Documented information about a data breach being detected

label: Data Breach Notice
definition: Notice associated with data breach providing information in compliance with GDPR

label: Data Breach Notice Requirement
definition: Whether a Data Breach notification is required

label: Data Breach Ongoing Report
definition: Documented information about an ongoing data breach

label: Data Breach Preliminary Report
definition: Documented information about preliminary assessment regarding a data breach

label: Data Breach Register
definition: Register of data breaches containing facts relating to the personal data breach, its effects and the remedial action taken

label: Data Breach Report
definition: Documented information about a data breach incident, its handling, assessments, and notifications

label: Data Subject Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Data Subject

label: Data Subject Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Data Subject is required

label: Integrity Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an unauthorised or accidental alteration of personal data

label: Processor Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Processor

label: Processor Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Processor is required

label: GDPR Compliance Unknown
definition: State where lawfulness or compliance with GDPR is unknown

label: GDPR Compliant
definition: State of being lawful or legally compliant for GDPR

label: GDPR Lawfulness
definition: Status or state associated with being lawful or legally compliant regarding GDPR

label: GDPR Non-compliant
definition: State of being unlawful or legally non-compliant for GDPR

label: Accountability Principle
definition: Principle stating the controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with the other principles (from Art.5-1)

label: Accuracy Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay used for

label: DataMinimisation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed

label: Fairness Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed fairly in relation to the data subject

label: IntegrityConfidentiality Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures

label: Lawfulness Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed in a lawfull manner in relation to the data subject

label: PurposeLimitation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes; further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes

label: StorageLimitation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed; personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject

label: Transparency Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject

label: A13 Right to be Informed
definition: information to be provided where personal data is directly collected from data subject

label: A14 Right to be Informed
definition: information to be provided where personal data is collected from other sources

label: A15 Right of Access
definition: Right of access

label: A16 Right to Rectification
definition: Right to rectification

label: A17 Right to Erasure
definition: Right to erasure ('Right to be forgotten')

label: A18 Right to Restrict Processing
definition: Right to restriction of processing

label: A19 Right to Rectification Notification
definition: Right to be notified in case of rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing

label: A20 Right to Data Portability
definition: Right to data portability

label: A21 Right to object
definition: Right to object to processing of personal data

label: A22 Right to object to automated decision making
definition: Right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing including profiling

definition: Personal data can flow freely from the EU to a third country with an Adequacy Decision without any further safeguard being necessary.

label: Art.6(1-a) regular consent
definition: Legal basis based on data subject's given non-explicit express consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes
scopenote: Definition of consent: A data subject's unambigious/clear affirmative action that signifies an agreement to process their personal data (Rigo Wenning) . What is referred to as 'non-explicit consent' here is also termed as 'regular' consent in the Article 29 Working Party document "Guidelines on Consent under Regulation 2016/679 (wp259rev.01)". This is the legal basis that requires consent but not at the level of being 'explicit'.;Definition of consent: A data subject's unambigious/clear affirmative action that signifies an agreement to process their personal data (Rigo Wenning) . label: Art 6(1-b) contract
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract

label: Art 6(1-b) contract performance
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a contract to which the data subject is party

label: Art 6(1-b) enter into contract
definition: Legal basis based on taking steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract

label: Art 6(1-c) legal obligation
definition: Legal basis based on compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests of data subject
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of the data subject

label: Art 6(1-d) protect vital interests of natural person
definition: Legal basis based on protecting the vital interests of another natural person that is not the data subject

label: Art 6(1-e) public interest or official authority
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller

label: Art 6(1-e) official authority
definition: Legal basis based on the exercise of official authority vested in the controller

label: Art 6(1-e) public interest
definition: Legal basis based on performance of a task carried out in the public interest

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest of controller
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: Art 6(1-f) legitimate interest of third party
definition: Legal basis based on the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child

label: A7-3 Right to Withdraw Consent
definition: Right to withdraw consent at any time

label: A77 Right to Complaint
definition: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

label: Art 9(2-a) explicit consent
definition: explicit consent with special categories of data

label: Art 9(2-b) employment, social security, social protection law
definition: employment and social security and social protection law

label: Art 9(2-c) protect vital interest
definition: protection of the vital interests

label: Art 9(2-d) legitimate activities
definition: legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects;

label: Art 9(2-e) data made public
definition: data manifestly made public by the data subject

label: Art 9(2-f) judicial process
definition: establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims / courts acting in their judicial capacity

label: Art 9(2-g) public interest
definition: substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law

label: Art 9(2-h) health & medicine
definition: preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3

label: Art 9(2-i) public interest in public health
definition: public interest in public health

label: Art 9(2-j) public interest, scientific research, statistical purpose
definition: public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes based on Union or Member State law

label: Accountability Principle
definition: Principle stating the controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with the other principles (from Art.5-1)

label: Accuracy Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date; every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay used for

label: AdHoc Contractual Clauses
definition: Contractual Clauses not drafted by the EU Commission, e.g. by the Controller

label: Availability Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an accidental or unauthorised loss of access to or destruction of personal data

label: Binding Corporate Rules (BCR)
definition: Binding corporate rules (BCR) are data protection policies adhered to by companies established in the EU for transfers of personal data outside the EU within a group of undertakings or enterprises.

label: Breach Notification Not Needed
definition: Data Breach notifications to DPA or Data Subjects are not required

label: Certification Mechanisms for Data Transfers
definition: Certification and its binding or specified mechanisms intended to provide sufficient safeguards for data transfers

label: Codes of Conduct for Data Transfers
definition: Codes of Conduct that outline sufficient safeguards for carrying out data transfers

label: Confidentiality Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an unauthorised or accidental disclosure of or access to personal data

label: Controller Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Controller

label: Controller Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Controller is required

label: Cross-Border Data Breach
definition: A data breach involving cross-border data subjects or processing operations

label: DBIA Indicates High Risk
definition: DBIA identifying high risk levels regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Indicates Low Risk
definition: DBIA identifying low risk levels regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Indicates No Risk
definition: DBIA identifying no risk is present regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DBIA Risk Status
definition: Status reflecting the status of risk associated with a DBIA regarding rights and freedoms of natural persons

label: DPA Breach Initial Notice
definition: Notice sent by a Controller within 72 hours of becoming aware of a personal data breach to the competent DPA, with justifications provided where the notice is made after 72 hours

label: DPA Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the DPA

label: DPA Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the DPA is required

label: DPA Bundled Breach Notice
definition: Notice sent by a Controller to the DPA regarding multiple data breaches concerning the same type of personal data

label: DPA Phased Breach Notice
definition: Notice sent to a DPA in phases i.e. by providing incremental information as it becomes available or is requested following previously submitted notifications

label: DPIA Conformant
definition: Expressing the specified process is conformant with a DPIA

label: DPIA Conformity
definition: Conformity of a process with a DPIA

label: DPIA Indicates High Risk
definition: DPIA identifying high risk levels

label: DPIA Indicates Low Risk
definition: DPIA identifying low risk levels

label: DPIA Indicates No Risk
definition: DPIA identifying no risk is present

label: DPIA Necessity Assessment
definition: Process that determines whether a DPIA is necessary

label: DPIA Necessity Status
definition: Status reflecting whether a DPIA is necessary

label: DPIA Non-Conformant
definition: Expressing the specified process is not conformant with a DPIA

label: DPIA Not Required
definition: Condition where a DPIA is not required

label: DPIA Outcome
definition: Process representing determining outcome of a DPIA

label: DPIA Outcome DPA Consultation
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating a DPA consultation is required

label: DPIA Outcome High Residual Risk
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating high residual risk which are not acceptable for continuation

label: DPIA Outcome Risks Acceptable
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating residual risks remain and are acceptable for continuation

label: DPIA Outcome Risks Mitigated
definition: DPIA outcome status indicating (all) risks have been mitigated

label: DPIA Outcome Status
definition: Status reflecting the outcomes of a DPIA

label: DPIA Procedure
definition: Process representing carrying out a DPIA

label: DPIA Processing Recommendation
definition: Recommendation from the DPIA regarding processing

label: DPIA Recommends Processing Continue
definition: Recommendation from a DPIA that the processing may continue

label: DPIA Recommends Processing Not Continue
definition: Recommendation from a DPIA that the processing should not continue

label: DPIA Required
definition: Condition where a DPIA is required

label: DPIA Risk Status
definition: Status reflecting the status of risk associated with a DPIA

label: Data Breach
definition: A breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed
scopenote: GDPR's notion of data breach includes any incident that affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data and its processing without distinguishing between internal or external actors involved in the incident;GDPR's notion of data breach includes any incident that affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data and its processing without distinguishing between internal or external actors involved in the incident

label: Data Breach Concluding Report
definition: Documented information about a concluded data breach incident

label: Data Breach Detection Report
definition: Documented information about a data breach being detected

label: Data Breach Notice
definition: Notice associated with data breach providing information in compliance with GDPR

label: Data Breach Notice Requirement
definition: Whether a Data Breach notification is required

label: Data Breach Ongoing Report
definition: Documented information about an ongoing data breach

label: Data Breach Preliminary Report
definition: Documented information about preliminary assessment regarding a data breach

label: Data Breach Register
definition: Register of data breaches containing facts relating to the personal data breach, its effects and the remedial action taken

label: Data Breach Report
definition: Documented information about a data breach incident, its handling, assessments, and notifications

label: DataMinimisation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed

label: Data Subject Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Data Subject

label: Data Subject Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Data Subject is required

label: Data Transfer Tool
definition: A legal instrument or tool intended to assist or justify data transfers

label: Direct Data Collection Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.13 regarding information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject

label: Fairness Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed fairly in relation to the data subject

label: GDPR Compliance Unknown
definition: State where lawfulness or compliance with GDPR is unknown

label: GDPR Compliant
definition: State of being lawful or legally compliant for GDPR

label: GDPR Lawfulness
definition: Status or state associated with being lawful or legally compliant regarding GDPR

label: GDPR Non-compliant
definition: State of being unlawful or legally non-compliant for GDPR

label: Indirect Data Collection Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.14 regarding information to be provided where personal data are not collected from the data subject

label: Integrity Breach
definition: A data breach where there is an unauthorised or accidental alteration of personal data

label: IntegrityConfidentiality Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures

label: Lawfulness Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed in a lawfull manner in relation to the data subject

label: Processor Breach Notice
definition: Notice regarding a data breach to the Processor

label: Processor Breach Notification Needed
definition: Data Breach notification to the Processor is required

label: PurposeLimitation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes; further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes

label: Rights Recipients Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.19 regarding Recipients to whom a rights exercise has been communicated, such as regarding rectification (A.16) or erasure of personal data (A.17) or restriction of processing (A.18)

label: SAR Notice
definition: A Notice provided in fulfilment of GDPR's Art.15 regarding information to be provided for Right of Access or Subject Access Request (SAR)

label: SCCs adopted by Commission
definition: Standard contractual clauses adopted by the Commission in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in GDPR Article 93(2)

label: SCCs adopted by Supervisory Authority
definition: Standard data protection clauses adopted by a supervisory authority and approved by the Commission pursuant to the examination procedure referred to in GDPR Article 93(2)

label: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC)
definition: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) are pre-approved clauses by the EU for ensuring appropriate data protection safeguards intended for data transfers from the EU to third countries

label: StorageLimitation Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed; personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject

label: Supplementary Measure
definition: Supplementary measures are intended to additionally provide safeguards or guarentees to bring the resulting protection in line with EU requirements

label: Transparency Principle
definition: Principle stating personal data must be processed processed in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject

label: AI System
definition: A machine-based system designed to operate with varying levels of autonomy and that may exhibit adaptiveness after deployment and that, for explicit or implicit objectives, infers, from the input it receives, how to generate outputs such as predictions, content, recommendations, or decisions that can influence physical or virtual environments
scopenote: Note All references to the AI Act referred to the provisional agreement published in Feb 2024;Note All references to the AI Act referred to the provisional agreement published in Feb 2024

label: Biometric Categorisation System
definition: An AI system for the purpose of assigning natural persons to specific categories on the basis of their biometric data unless ancillary to another commercial service and strictly necessary for objective technical reasons

label: Emotion Recognition System
definition: An AI system for the purpose of identifying or inferring emotions or intentions of natural persons on the basis of their biometric data.

label: General Purpose AI Model
definition: An AI model, including when trained with a large amount of data using self-supervision at scale, that displays significant generality and is capable to competently perform a wide range of distinct tasks regardless of the way the model is placed on the market and that can be integrated into a variety of downstream systems or applications. This does not cover AI models that are used before release on the market for research, development and prototyping activities

label: General Purpose AI System
definition: An AI system which is based on a general-purpose AI model, that has the capability to serve a variety of purposes, both for direct use as well as for integration in other AI systems

label: Post Remote Biometric Identification System
definition: A remote biometric identification system other than a ‘real-time’ remote biometric identification system

label: Real-time Remote Biometric Identification System
definition: A remote biometric identification system whereby the capturing of biometric data, the comparison and the identification all occur without a significant delay. This comprises not only instant identification, but also limited short delays in order to avoid circumvention.

label: Remote Biometric Identification System
definition: An AI system for the purpose of identifying natural persons, without their active involvement, typically at a distance through the comparison of a person’s biometric data with the biometric data contained in a reference database.

label: Safety Component
definition: A component of a product or of a system which fulfils a safety function for that product or system, or the failure or malfunctioning of which endangers the health and safety of persons or property

label: Available on EU Market
definition: Status associated with supply of an AI system or a general purpose AI model for distribution or use on the Union market in the course of a commercial activity, whether in return for payment or free of charge

label: Available on Market
definition: Status associated with supply of an AI system or a general purpose AI model for distribution or use on the market in the course of a commercial activity, whether in return for payment or free of charge

label: Available on Non-EU Market
definition: Status associated with supply of an AI system or a general purpose AI model for distribution or use on any market except the Union market in the course of a commercial activity, whether in return for payment or free of charge

label: Market Availability Status
definition: Status associated with whether the AI system or GPAI Model is available for distribution or use on the market in the course of a commercial activity

label: Market Placement Status
definition: Status associated with whether the AI system or GPAI Model has been 'first' made available on the market

label: Not Available on Market
definition: not available on a market anywhere in EU or otherwise

label: Not Put in to Service
definition: Status associated with an AI system that has not been put into service

label: Placed on EU Market
definition: Status indicating the first making available of an AI system or a general purpose AI model on the Union market

label: Placed on Market
definition: Status indicating the first making available of an AI system or a general purpose AI model on the market

label: Put in to Service
definition: Status asssociated with the supply of an AI system for first use directly to the deployer or for own use for its intended purpose

label: Put in to Service In EU
definition: Status asssociated with the supply of an AI system for first use directly to the deployer or for own use in the Union for its intended purpose

label: Recalled from Service
definition: An AI System that is returned to the provider or taken out of service or use

label: Service Supply Status
definition: Status asssociated with whether the AI system has been supplied for use or put in to service or been recalled or withdrawn

label: Withdrawn from Service
definition: An AI System that is prevented to be made available in the supply chain
